chunks.original_text: 贪罗郁罗，符无苏陀。 太冲太极，阴阳包和。 出有入无，鬼神莫测。 出死入生，变化自然。 元始混炁，玄中之玄。 上干有顶，下洞太渊。 诵之一徧，况痾自痊。 炼魂育魄，真阳自全。 斋戒礼诵，万过飞仙。 无上密咒，万神绵绵。 心中心咒，重复宣传。 贪罗洞明，与道合真。 玉清上极，梵炁氤氲。 分灵布炁，降注臣身。 形神俱妙，变化飞升。 一如令格，统摄万灵。 急急一如元始上帝玄都律令。 无上玄元太上道君召出臣身中三五功曹、左右官使者、侍香金童、传言玉女、五帝直符直日香官各三十二人，关启所言。 今日吉庆，长斋清堂，修行至经。 臣今奏为某愿得所启，径御上彻无上三十二天元始上帝至尊几前。 行道有二：烧香诵经，步虚朝赞，亦云行道； 精炼身心，行持道德，亦云行道。 沐浴，沐者，沐发； 浴者，浴身。 亦有二法：以五香水持咒洗身，此外沐浴； 大行梵炁，周回十方，以至中理五炁，混合百神，即内沐浴。 斋者，非止禁茹荤食秽、远离贪淫，亦欲齐心以防患，戒性以绝非。 入室者盖欲入靖绝尘，身心专注，可与神灵交通者也。 东向为长生之方，召集真炁，以生为本。 叩齿之法，左为天锺，右为天磬，召仙灵也。 中为天鼓，朝上圣也。 心拜者，身形不动，专意存礼。 闭目者，收视内观，炁乃凝寂。 青为玄一之炁，黄为元一之炁，白为始一之炁。 三色之义，取法三清。 坐而存之，神明自见也。 如是内境亦明，外境亦明，蓊然冥合，故曰苍冥。 次存青龙自肝出，居吾左； 白虎自肺出，居吾右； 朱雀自心出，居吾前； 玄武自肾出，居吾后。 狮子白鹤各以六数存之，自六腑而出，居吾左右前后。 左目化为日轮，现紫赤之光九重； 右目化为月轮，现黄白之光十重； 与身相去九尺，光明焕烂，射入鼻中，通脑后，入金华宫，结成圆光大如车轮。 以前青、黄、白三色有间，是为九色圆象； 以此光明徧彻十方世界，然后微音次第存神史俱自吾之顶出，布列于前。 述愿祝之，次存思三十二天，一一取炁咽之而毕。 颂曰： 闭目将身子细观，定中别是一乾坤。 圆光出现仙灵集，问尔谁为元始尊。 元始无量度人上品妙经注卷上竟 元始无量度人上品妙经注卷中 元始无量度人上品妙经 元为万物之根，立乎大象之首，寥廓而幽光，运化而不穷。 人能深其根、固其蒂，与天相久矣。 颂曰： 自已根宗欲了真，铁鞋踏破谩劳形。 痴儿住舍须千载，今日方能识主人。 始为恍惚之数，在毫末之初，变化之先者； 万物起乎始，归乎终； 复归元始。 始之为义，湛然独尊，而变迁遂有形质。 颂曰： 当时愚鲁未知贤，被汝勾牵入世缠。 有志丈夫终识破，去来自在不攀缘。 无者，有也，有即无也。 无有有无为道之本，迎之不见其首，随之不见其后，隐然默存也。 颂曰： 恍惚之中妙用殊，个中端的立形躯。 不须境外徒劳觅，混物氤氲更是谁。 量者，道之用，极而不尽也。 天之数一，地之数二，万物之数三。 一、二、三，万物极品类殊，当归其一，以此为量，即无量也。 颂曰： 登高看处几由旬，无极无穷甚杳冥。 俯仰不知天地阔，要须笼络一其真。 度者，道无体也，含光而立人； 无根也，变伪为真。 元一变生神，神一变生真，真一变生道。
chunks.translated_text:
"Tānluó Yùluó, seal without Suddha.
Supreme Harmony, Supreme Ultimate—yin and yang embrace in harmony.
Emerging from existence, entering non-existence, ghosts and spirits cannot fathom.
Exiting death, entering life, transformations arise naturally.
Primal Chaos of Original Qi, mystery within mystery.
Above, it reaches the Heavenly Summit; below, it penetrates the Great Abyss.
Recite once through, and even chronic ailments heal of themselves.
Refine the hun-soul, nurture the po-soul, true yang is preserved whole.
With fasting, rites, and recitation, ten thousand repetitions ascend as an immortal.
The supreme secret incantation, ten thousand spirits endure unbroken.
The heart’s core incantation, proclaimed again and again:
Tānluó illumines profoundly, merging with the Dao in truth.
Jade Purity’s Supreme Pole, Brahma-qi billows in mist.
Dispersing numinous spirits, distributing qi, descending to infuse this servant’s body.
Form and spirit both wondrous, transforming and ascending in flight.
All as decreed, governing the ten thousand spirits.
Hasten! As decreed by the Original Supreme Lord of the Mysterious Capital’s statutes.

The Most High Mysterious Primordial Supreme Dao Lord summons forth from this servant’s body:
The Three and Five Merit Officers, left and right official messengers,
Incense-bearing Golden Lads, message-transmitting Jade Maidens,
and the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans, Direct Day Incense Officers—thirty-two each—
to open and transmit these words.
Today is auspicious, a long fast in the pure hall, cultivating the supreme scripture.
This servant petitions on behalf of so-and-so, wishing that what is declared may ascend directly to the presence of the Most High Original Supreme Lord before the Thirty-Two Heavens’ throne.

There are two kinds of practicing the Way:
Burning incense and reciting scriptures, pacing the void in homage and praise—this is called practicing the Way;
Refining body and mind, upholding virtue and power—this too is called practicing the Way.

Bathing: *mu* means washing the hair; *yu* means washing the body.
There are also two methods:
Using five-fragrance water with incantations to wash the body—this is external bathing;
Greatly circulating Brahma-qi through the ten directions, reaching the central harmony of the five qi, blending with the hundred spirits—this is internal bathing.

Fasting: It is not merely abstaining from impure foods, meat, and lust, but also aligning the mind to prevent calamity, and restraining the nature to eliminate wrongdoing.
Entering the chamber means entering stillness, free from dust, with body and mind wholly focused, so as to commune with the divine.
Facing east is the direction of long life, summoning true qi, with life as the foundation.

The method of knocking the teeth:
The left is the Heavenly Bell, the right is the Heavenly Chime—summoning immortals and spirits.
The center is the Heavenly Drum—paying homage to the supreme sages.
Heart-bowing means the body remains unmoving, the mind wholly intent on reverence.
Closing the eyes means withdrawing vision to inwardly observe, so qi congeals in stillness.

Green is the qi of the Mysterious One,
Yellow is the qi of the Primordial One,
White is the qi of the Original One.
The meaning of the three colors is drawn from the Three Pure Ones.
Sitting in meditation, the divine luminaries appear of themselves.

Thus, the inner realm is bright, the outer realm is bright,
Merging in profound darkness—this is called "verdant obscurity."
Next, visualize the Green Dragon emerging from the liver, stationed to the left;
The White Tiger emerging from the lungs, stationed to the right;
The Vermilion Bird emerging from the heart, stationed in front;
The Dark Warrior emerging from the kidneys, stationed behind.
The Lion and White Crane, each visualized in sixfold formation, emerge from the six viscera, stationed to left and right, front and back.

The left eye transforms into the solar orb, manifesting nine layers of purple-red light;
The right eye transforms into the lunar orb, manifesting ten layers of yellow-white light.
Nine feet distant from the body, their radiance blazes brilliantly,
Shining into the nostrils, passing through the brain’s rear, entering the Golden Flower Palace,
Congealing into a wheel-like halo of light.
Previously, the green, yellow, and white colors were distinct—now they form a nine-colored circular image.
With this radiance pervading the ten directions of the world,
Then, in subtle tones, visualize the divine scribes emerging from the crown, arrayed before you.
State your vows and prayers, then visualize the Thirty-Two Heavens one by one, drawing in their qi and swallowing it to completion.

A verse says:
Closing the eyes, observe the body in fine detail,
In concentration, another universe unfolds.
The circular light appears, immortals gather—
Ask yourself: Who is the Original Supreme?

*Commentary on the Supreme Original Vastly Saving Humankind’s Upper Chapter of Wondrous Scripture* concludes.

*Commentary on the Supreme Original Vastly Saving Humankind’s Middle Chapter of Wondrous Scripture*

The Original is the root of the ten thousand things, standing at the head of the great image,
Vast and boundless, its subtle light endures, its transformations inexhaustible.
If one can deepen the root and secure the stem, one abides with Heaven for eternity.

A verse says:
To realize one’s root and origin, the truth is sought,
Iron sandals worn thin, the form wearies in vain.
Foolish children cling to their dwellings for a thousand years—
Only today do they recognize the true Master.

The Original is the reckoning of the indistinct, in the infinitesimal’s inception, before all transformations;
The ten thousand things arise from the Original, return to the end,
And cycle back to the Original.
The meaning of the Original is profound, uniquely revered,
Yet through change and flux, form and substance emerge.

A verse says:
Once foolish and ignorant, unaware of the worthy,
Drawn into the world’s entanglements by you.
The resolute man ultimately sees through it—
Coming and going freely, without clinging.

Non-existence is existence; existence is non-existence.
Non-existence and existence are the Dao’s root.
Approaching it, its beginning is unseen; following it, its end is unseen—
Hidden yet silently present.

A verse says:
Within the indistinct, wondrous functions abound,
Therein the true form takes shape.
No need to seek beyond the realm—
Who else could blend with the misty qi of all things?

Measure is the Dao’s function, inexhaustible in its extremity.
Heaven’s number is one, Earth’s number is two, the ten thousand things’ number is three.
One, two, three—though the myriad things’ supreme forms differ,
They all return to the One. Taking this as measure is called "immeasurable."

A verse says:
Gazing from on high, how many leagues are seen?
Boundless and infinite, profoundly obscure.
Looking up and down, the vastness of Heaven and Earth unknown—
One must embrace and unify the true.

Salvation: The Dao has no form, yet by containing light, it establishes humanity;
It has no root, yet transforms the false into the true.
The Original One transforms to generate spirit,
Spirit transforms to generate the true,
The true transforms to generate the Dao."

chunks.original_text: 物假物成物，人假真成道； 识物守真，斯为度矣。 颂曰： 土木形骸竟属空，无明影裹逐洪蒙。 须凭物外非常术，方可飞腾出世笼。 人者，杳冥恍惚要妙之问，人在其中矣。 恍恍惚惚，火中生神； 杳杳冥冥，水中生精。 火炎升上，七变为神； 水流降下，六化为精。 七六变化，上下相成，精神往来，妙体含真，各真其真，是谓真人也。 颂曰： 此身元自贵无比，本来湛寂通天地。 造化只凭阴与阳，地水火风都是秽。 上者，道之妙也。 吞赤纳黄，吸苍服素，收元於元宫，生神生象焉。 然后弃万物、遗万化、独得其玄，是谓无上之上。 颂曰： 三百功成万行奇，尘中夺得锦标归。 玉台已为题名籍，方显男儿志不卑。 品者，识众观一，守一抱一，归吾至一，是谓之品。 道本无形，言安有品？ 方便设教，故有品也。 颂曰： 三千六百法门多，只要分明识正他。 大道不期千日就，休教岁月谩蹉跎。 妙者，万法之宗，故天地虚妙而清，阴阳同妙而纯，日月合妙而明，五行含妙而精，万物尽妙而真。 妙观者，见无象之象； 妙听者，闻无声之声。 不可视、不可听、不可有、不可无，斯为真妙矣。 颂曰： 不无不有本纯真，非色非声绝等伦。 模写形容难到处，玄中位象甚分明。 经者，天地之经纶； 日月运行，昼夜不息，终而复始，化而不尽者也。 古之人仰视俯察，必依乎道，不踰轨、不失常、不以外物失其素，斯经之本也。 颂曰： 屈指师资愿力悲，骊珠不惜等闲挥。 分明指我飞仙道，山岳玄恩报勿亏。 参校赞元始二字，赞云：大象之先，强名曰元，天地之祖，万物之源。 三才既分，有始可言，人知还返，终归其根。 真空寂照，浩劫之前。 无量二字赞云：形未有时，道实在兹，莫知其名，以无字之； 不可究诘，孰能测窥，即此为量，其量莫推； 玄之又玄，悟者同归。 度人二字赞云：形既有时，变化由斯； 所以变者，非道而谁？ 伪度而真，腐度而奇。 众人之中，独异何为？ 蜕凡入圣，同夷希微。 上品二字赞云：莫知其高，乃以上言； 有物混成，在天地先。 自下而观，孰居其前？ 即此为品，言岂容宣！ 等伦之中，迥出超然。 妙经二字赞云：朝阳升东，夜月当空，玉出石璞，珠现蚌中。 最贵者道，妙岂可穷？ 敷落为经，真常则同，天地有劫，妙经无终。 元始阐道开化普度章 阐扬道德，开化人天。 周治三界，是则名普。 参校曰：经有道言，此二章之标揭，而青元真人经注，以此表二章之一也。 立象起修，四百五十七言。 凡夫性昧，背本失真，故首立象法，开示蹊径，为道之根本。 参校曰：清河老人序迷青元经注有曰：条分八事，此八事之一也。 元始洞玄，灵宝本章，上品妙首，十回度人，百魔隐韵，离合自然。 此乃天真皇人迷经本旨，言天尊含弘妙道，禀立自然，覆盖万品，最尊最贵，洞观玄一，化度人天，故云元始洞玄也。 能以大慧光明焕照十方世界。 在天曰灵，在世曰宝，故曰灵宝。 皆金口敷演，故云本章，具载修真合道之本，其品最上，为众妙之首，密隐魔真之讳。 合梵炁而凝，散则为炁，合则为文，乃变化消息之道，非墨迹之比，为万法之祖，三洞之尊。 智者识之，修炼成宝。 《黄庭经》云：治生之道了不烦，祖修洞玄与玉篇。

Things borrow things to complete things; humans borrow the true to complete the Dao.
Recognizing things while guarding the true—this is called "salvation."

A verse says:
The earthen and wooden form is ultimately empty,
Within the shadow of ignorance, chasing the vast chaos.
One must rely on extraordinary arts beyond things,
Only then can one soar free from the cage of the world.

The human is the subtle inquiry into the profound and indistinct;
the human exists within it.
Vague and indistinct, spirit is born in fire;
profound and obscure, essence is born in water.
Fire flames upward, seven transformations make spirit;
water flows downward, six transformations make essence.
The seven and six transformations, above and below completing each other,
spirit and essence intermingling, the wondrous body contains the true.
Each true to its truth—this is called the "true person."

A verse says:
This body is originally of incomparable worth,
Originally serene and still, connecting heaven and earth.
Creation relies solely on yin and yang,
Earth, water, fire, and wind are all impurities.

The highest is the Dao’s subtlety.
Swallowing the red, absorbing the yellow, inhaling the blue-green, ingesting the white,
gathering the primordial in the primordial palace, giving birth to spirit and form.
Then, abandoning the ten thousand things, forsaking the ten thousand transformations,
alone attaining the mysterious—this is called "the highest of the high."

A verse says:
Three hundred merits achieved, ten thousand practices wondrous,
Amid the dust, seizing the prize and returning.
The Jade Terrace has already inscribed your name,
Only then does a man’s ambition show no baseness.

Rank: recognizing the many while observing the One,
guarding the One and embracing the One,
returning to our utmost One—this is called "rank."
The Dao is originally formless; how could words have rank?
For expedient teaching, ranks are thus established.

A verse says:
Three thousand six hundred dharma gates are many,
One must clearly recognize the correct one.
The great Dao does not expect a thousand days to complete;
do not let the years and months pass in vain.

The wondrous is the origin of the ten thousand methods.
Thus, heaven and earth are empty and wondrous yet clear;
yin and yang share the wondrous and are pure;
the sun and moon unite in the wondrous and are bright;
the five phases contain the wondrous and are refined;
the ten thousand things are all wondrous and true.
The wondrous gaze sees the formless form;
the wondrous hearing hears the soundless sound.
Not to be seen, not to be heard, not to be had, not to be without—
this is called true wondrousness.

A verse says:
Neither non-being nor being, originally pure and true,
Neither form nor sound, beyond all comparison.
Where depiction and description cannot reach,
In the profound, the position and image are most distinct.

The scripture is the warp and weft of heaven and earth;
the sun and moon move, day and night unceasing,
endlessly cycling, transforming without exhaustion.
The ancients, looking up and down, necessarily relied on the Dao,
not transgressing the path, not losing constancy,
not losing their essence through external things—
this is the root of the scripture.

A verse says:
Counting on fingers, the master’s compassionate vow,
The black pearl is not idly cast aside.
Clearly pointing to the immortal’s path for me,
Repay the profound grace of the mountains and peaks without fail.

**Eulogy for "Original Beginning"**
Before the great image, forcibly named "Original,"
Ancestor of heaven and earth, source of the ten thousand things.
After the Three Powers divided, a beginning could be spoken;
humans know to return, ultimately reverting to their root.
True emptiness, luminous illumination, before kalpas.

**Eulogy for "Boundless"**
Before form existed, the Dao was truly here,
Its name unknown, thus called "without";
Unfathomable, who could probe or perceive?
Taking this as measure, its measure cannot be reckoned;
Mysterious and again mysterious, those who awaken return together.

**Eulogy for "Salvation of Humans"**
Once form exists, transformation begins here;
What causes transformation, if not the Dao?
Transforming the false into true, decay into wonder.
Among the multitude, why be uniquely different?
Shedding the mortal to enter the sacred, merging with the subtle and rare.

**Eulogy for "Supreme Rank"**
Its height unknown, thus called "supreme";
A thing formed in chaos, before heaven and earth.
Looking up from below, who stands before it?
Taking this as rank, how could words suffice to declare!
Among all peers, uniquely transcendent and surpassing.

**Eulogy for "Wondrous Scripture"**
The morning sun rises in the east, the night moon hangs in the sky,
Jade emerges from uncut stone, pearls appear in oyster shells.
The most precious is the Dao; how could the wondrous be exhausted?
Spreading forth as scripture, eternally constant and unchanging,
Heaven and earth have kalpas, the wondrous scripture has no end.

**Chapter on the Original Beginning Expounding the Dao and Universally Salvation**
Expounding the Dao and virtue, enlightening humans and heavens,
Governing the three realms—this is called "universal."
*Collation:* The scripture contains Daoist words; these two chapters serve as their banner,
and the *Qingyuan Zhenren Scripture Commentary* uses this to represent one of the two chapters.

Establishing images to initiate cultivation, four hundred fifty-seven words.
Ordinary beings, their nature obscured, turn from their root and lose the true,
thus first establishing image-methods to open the path,
as the root of the Dao.
*Collation:* The *Preface to the Qingyuan Scripture Commentary* by the Old Man of Qinghe says:
"Divided into eight matters"—this is one of those eight.

The Original Beginning, cavernously mysterious,
the root chapter of the Numinous Treasure,
supreme wondrous head,
ten cycles of salvation,
hundred demons hidden in rhyme,
naturally converging and diverging.
This is the original intent of the *Scripture of the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign*,
speaking of the Heavenly Worthy containing the vast and wondrous Dao,
endowed with spontaneity,
covering the ten thousand ranks,
most honored and most noble,
penetratingly observing the mysterious One,
transforming and saving humans and heavens—
thus called the *Cavernously Mysterious Original Beginning*.
With great wisdom and luminous brilliance, it illuminates the ten directions of the world.
In heaven, it is called "numinous"; in the world, it is called "treasure"—
thus called *Numinous Treasure*.
All spoken from the golden mouth, thus called the "root chapter,"
fully containing the root of cultivating the true and uniting with the Dao.
Its rank is supreme, the head of all wonders,
secretly concealing the taboo names of demonic truths.
Converging with primordial qi to congeal,
dispersing as qi, converging as script,
this is the Dao of transformation and fluctuation,
not to be compared to ink traces,
the ancestor of the ten thousand methods,
the honored one of the Three Caverns.
The wise recognize it and cultivate to complete the treasure.
The *Yellow Court Scripture* says:
"The Dao of nurturing life is not troublesome;
ancestral cultivation is the *Cavernous Mystery* and the *Jade Chapters*."

chunks.original_text: 此之谓也。 颂曰： 欲知元始度人方，灵宝元来号本章。 内隐百魔谁会得，若能离合自然光。 混洞赤文，无无上真，元始祖劫，化生诸天。 开明三景，是为天根，上无复祖，唯道为身，五文开廓，普植神灵。 混洞者，天地未判之象也。 元始之前，其炁纯而赤，风泽相混，是为大洞。 始结文章，唯天尊凝凝独立，在无无之最上，得真中之至真，故云无无上真。 元始祖劫，即龙汉小劫，曰延康。 初因一炁生三炁，为三清上境； 三炁生九炁，以成九天； 九天之外，又列三十二天，即化生诸天也。 然后布日月星辰，主持万物，即开明三景之光，为天地之象，然不逃迁变之运。 天尊乃含混洞始，生五行真炁，凝为符篆，俾安镇天地，生化神灵，尸於三界，使主持万法，故得悬而不落，久而不坏者也。 以此五文演成五千之字，具载妙元神真道之根本，上应五行，为开化之首也。 如人之未形，神识安在哉。 混混沌沌，屯屯蒙蒙、无分无别、不有不无、无无曰道，道为人之根，此道之散，遂成其朴。 朴散为炁，炁凝生神，神具则有形矣。 乃人之本元，本始如此。 然后布三田，开九窍，五脏六腑，即化生诸天之象。 三田者，精血之凑理、万炁之根原。 即开明三景，为一身阴阳，营卫之本也。 且人之生，虽自胞胎，其元则起於元始之始，谁祖谁宗，禀道炁为，质假精血，而寓成变化者也。 五神列布，然后三万六千关节，根元本始一时生神，岂不为神灵普植哉。 乃知道不远人，人悟而修炼，可以升仙。 愚人执迷不能尊其炁、贵其根、保其命、固其形，自取死坏，离其本真耳。 故远於道也。 颂曰：

The ode says:
To know the Primordial Beginning’s method of delivering beings,
the *Numinous Treasure* was originally called the "root chapter."
Within it lie the hundred demons—who can comprehend?
If one can part and merge, radiance arises naturally.

The *Crimson Writ of Primal Chaos*, the Supreme Truth of Non-Being,
the Primordial Beginning of the Ancestral Kalpa,
transforms and gives birth to all heavens.
Illuminating the Three Luminaries,
this is the root of heaven,
above which there is no further ancestor—
only the Dao as its body.
The Five Scripts unfold and expand,
universally planting the divine spirits.

*Primal Chaos* is the state before heaven and earth divided.
Before the Primordial Beginning,
its qi was pure and crimson,
wind and marsh intermingling—
this is the *Great Cavern*.
When script first took form,
only the Heavenly Worthy stood solitary in serene independence,
abiding in the supreme of Non-Being,
attaining the utmost truth within truth—
thus called the *Supreme Truth of Non-Being*.
The *Primordial Beginning of the Ancestral Kalpa*
is the lesser kalpa of *Dragon Han*, called *Yan Kang*.
First, one qi gave birth to three qi,
forming the Three Pure Realms above;
the three qi gave birth to nine qi,
completing the Nine Heavens.
Beyond the Nine Heavens lie the Thirty-Two Heavens—
thus are all heavens transformed and born.
Then the sun, moon, and stars were arrayed,
governing the ten thousand things—
this is the illumination of the Three Luminaries,
the image of heaven and earth,
yet it does not escape the workings of change and transformation.

The Heavenly Worthy, containing the beginning of *Primal Chaos*,
generated the true qi of the Five Phases,
condensing them into talismanic scripts
to pacify and stabilize heaven and earth,
giving birth to and transforming divine spirits,
abiding in the Three Realms
to govern the ten thousand methods.
Thus, they hang without falling,
enduring without decay.
From these Five Scripts were unfolded the five thousand characters,
fully containing the root of the wondrous, primordial, divine, and true Dao,
corresponding above to the Five Phases—
the origin of all transformation.

Like a person before form,
where does the spirit reside?
Chaotic and undifferentiated,
dense and obscure,
without division or distinction,
neither existent nor non-existent—
Non-Being is called the Dao,
the Dao is the root of humanity.
When this Dao scatters,
it becomes simplicity.
Simplicity scatters into qi,
qi congeals to form spirit,
and when spirit is complete,
form arises.
This is the original source of humanity,
its primordial beginning.

Then the Three Fields are arrayed,
the Nine Orifices opened,
the Five Viscera and Six Bowels formed—
the image of all heavens transformed and born.
The *Three Fields* are the convergence of essence and blood,
the root and origin of the ten thousand qi.
This is the illumination of the Three Luminaries,
the foundation of yin and yang in the body,
the root of nourishment and defense.

Though a person’s life begins in the womb,
its origin arises from the beginning of the Primordial Beginning.
Who is ancestor? Who is lineage?
Receiving the Dao’s qi as substance,
borrowing essence and blood as form,
dwelling within to accomplish transformation—
this is how it is.
When the Five Spirits are arrayed,
then the thirty-six thousand joints
simultaneously generate spirit from their root and origin.
Is this not the universal planting of divine spirits?

Thus, the Dao is not far from humanity.
If one awakens and cultivates,
one may ascend as an immortal.
The foolish, clinging to delusion,
fail to honor their qi,
value their root,
preserve their life,
or secure their form—
they bring about their own decay and death,
severing their original truth.
Thus, they distance themselves from the Dao.

chunks.original_text: 位极无无最上真，始乎龙汉迄于今。 不增不减常清静，是则名为大法身。 无文不光，无文不明，无文不立，无文不成，无文不度，无文不生。 大朴散，天地分； 灵文结，玉字出。 然后万象有光，万象开明，万法定立，万物自成，万灵受度，万类出生，若一炁未判，五文不形，则何以生成者哉。 如人之生，若非道炁，降以真灵资养，开之化之，则幻色之身，凭何据立矣。 颂曰： 灵宝分光初敞露，文章焕灿无今古。 安天镇地显生成，不是云云纸上语。 是为大梵，天中之天，郁罗萧台，玉山上京，上极无上，大罗玉清，渺渺劫仞，若亡若存，三华离便，大有妙庭，金阙玉房，森罗净霐。 大行梵炁，周回十方，中有度人不死之神，中有南极长生之君，中有度世司马大神，中有好生韩君丈人，中有南上司命司录、延寿益算、度厄尊神，回骸起死，无量度人。 今日校录，诸天临轩。 自无色以去，悉名梵天。 此云大梵者，即道炁始凝者也。 天中之天者，即三清大罗圣境也。 大者，覆盖万天； 罗者，罗络三界； 极高无上，故称大罗。 中有玉京之山，周回八万里，下与昆仑对立。 山有郁罗萧台，台有七宝城，城有玉清殿，天尊居其中。 上极，谓无极也。 渺渺浩勃，惟上仙视之即见，中下之仙不可窥也。 其高数仞而不可量，乍有乍无，故云若存若亡，乃元始消息之道。 又有三华离便之宫，大有之庭，皆宴息之所。 每诸天上帝相会之时，必步虚吟咏，三绕此庭，方睹玉相也。 金阙玉房、瑶池翠水，森森列布，凭梵炁周回运转不息，故得久而长存。 此宫有度人不死之神，隐居其中，亦元始分化之号。 长生君即朱陵大帝，治太微垣，司火炼之事。 度世君主阳九百六之变。 司马君主灭邪却试，好生君即青华之别名也，主治诠校。 韩君，主南昌，品秩学人。 司命司录，主功过，予夺延寿益算，主增注年命。 度厄之神，主消平厄难。 回骸起死君，主升度死魂，飞尸登晨。 今天尊说法之际，皆蒙召制，临集帝轩，校图检录，品度学人也。 如人之身，七宝之贵，与玉京无异。 脑宫为郁罗之台，金阙玉房森罗净霐，冥然列布，不死之神，位其中。 若使梵炁周回不息，亦如天之不落，久而无坏也。 颂曰： 梵炁周回徧十方，玉京金阙极森芒。 忘情内观三清境，尽是长生不死乡。 参校曰：经曰化生诸天，又曰是为大梵天中之天，以至大罗玉清。 经注已明别录。 又载九天、九霄、梵炁天名、霄名，今附录焉。 始青天附以太霄晖明流光素景天，青元天附以青霄元真宝曜天，始丹天附以丹霄总生开灵传道天，太丹天附以绛霄太平应化道主天，始素天附以景霄中极至妙变空天，太素天附以玉霄皓元威德耀晶天，始玄天附以琅霄飞青元关溥济名，太玄天附以紫霄合景双关化身天中天，清微天附以神霄玉清妙境，下统九霄梵炁。 又别本经注有三天、九天、三十二天之图，附生神章。 九天在三天之下，三十二天之上。 第一郁单无量天，在南； 第二上上禅善无量寿天，在西北； 第三梵监须延天，在东； 第四寂然兜术天，在西南； 第五波罗尼密不骄乐天，在东南； 第六洞无化应声天，在北； 第七灵化梵辅天，在西； 第八高虚清明天，在东北；
chunks.translated_text:
The supreme truth stands beyond the formless,
originating in the Dragon Han, enduring to this day.
Neither increasing nor diminishing, ever pure and still—
this is called the Great Dharmakāya.

Without script, no radiance;
without script, no illumination;
without script, no establishment;
without script, no completion;
without script, no deliverance;
without script, no generation.

When the Great Simplicity scattered, Heaven and Earth divided;
when the numinous script coalesced, the Jade Characters emerged.
Thereafter, the myriad forms gained light,
the myriad forms unfolded in clarity,
the myriad dharmas were firmly established,
the myriad things self-completed,
the myriad spirits received deliverance,
and the myriad kinds were born.
Had the primordial qi not divided and the Five Scripts not taken form,
how could generation and completion have come to be?

As with human birth—
were it not for the Dao’s qi descending to nourish with true numen,
opening and transforming,
how could this illusory, colored body stand firm?

The ode says:
The Numinous Treasure’s light first revealed,
its splendor resplendent, timeless and bright.
It stabilizes Heaven, anchors Earth, manifests creation—
not mere words upon paper.

This is the Great Brahmā,
the Heaven within Heaven,
the Yu Luo Xiao Terrace,
the Jade Mountain’s Upper Capital.
Supreme beyond the supreme,
the Great Net of Jade Purity,
boundless and measureless,
now present, now absent—
the Three Flowers depart, the wondrous court of Great Existence,
golden palaces and jade chambers,
a forest of purity and clarity.

The Great Brahmā qi circulates through the ten directions.
Within it dwell the immortal-delivering spirits,
the Southern Culmen’s Lord of Longevity,
the world-delivering Marshal of the Controller of Horses,
the life-cherishing Lord Han the Venerable,
the Southern Supernal Lords of Destiny and Records,
who extend life and augment fate,
the revered spirits who deliver from calamity,
who restore bones and raise the dead—
boundless deliverance of beings.

Today, as the register is reviewed,
the myriad heavens descend to the imperial terrace.

From the formless and beyond, all are called Brahmā Heavens.
This "Great Brahmā" refers to the first coagulation of the Dao’s qi.
The "Heaven within Heaven" is the sacred realm of the Three Purities and Great Net.
"Great" means covering the myriad heavens;
"Net" means encompassing the Three Realms.
Supreme beyond the supreme, thus it is called the Great Net.
Within it stands the Jade Capital Mountain,
eighty thousand leagues in circumference,
opposite Kunlun below.
The mountain bears the Yu Luo Xiao Terrace,
the terrace holds a seven-jeweled city,
the city contains the Jade Purity Hall,
where the Heavenly Worthy resides.

"Supreme" refers to the boundless.
Vast and unfathomable,
only the highest immortals perceive it;
middle and lower immortals cannot glimpse it.
Its height spans immeasurable leagues,
now appearing, now vanishing—
thus it is said to be now present, now absent,
the ebb and flow of the Primordial Beginning.

There is also the Palace of the Three Flowers Departed,
the court of Great Existence—
both places of repose.
When the Heavenly Emperors of the myriad heavens convene,
they must circumambulate thrice while chanting void-steps,
only then do they behold the Jade Countenance.

Golden palaces and jade chambers,
jade pools and emerald waters,
stand in solemn array.
Sustained by the ceaseless circulation of Brahmā qi,
they endure eternally.

Within this palace dwells the immortal-delivering spirit,
a manifestation of the Primordial Beginning.
The Lord of Longevity is the Great Emperor of Vermilion Mound,
who governs the Supreme Subtlety Enclosure,
overseeing the alchemy of fire.
The world-delivering Lord presides over the cycles of ninety-six solar phases.
The Marshal of the Controller of Horses dispels evil and averts trials.
The life-cherishing Lord is another name for Azure Radiance,
who oversees the evaluation of merits.
Lord Han governs Nanchang,
ranking and assessing practitioners.

The Lords of Destiny and Records govern merit and transgression,
bestowing or withholding, extending life and augmenting fate.
The spirits of deliverance from calamity resolve and pacify hardships.
The Lord of Restoring Bones and Raising the Dead ascends and delivers the dead,
causing flying corpses to ascend at dawn.

When the Heavenly Worthy expounds the Dao,
all are summoned to attend the imperial terrace,
reviewing registers and examining records,
ranking and delivering practitioners.

The human body, precious as the seven jewels,
is no different from the Jade Capital.
The brain palace is the Yu Luo Terrace,
golden palaces and jade chambers,
a forest of purity and clarity,
arrayed in profound stillness.
The immortal-delivering spirit resides within.
If the Brahmā qi circulates without cease,
it is like Heaven’s unceasing revolution—
enduring without decay.

chunks.original_text: 第九无想无结无爱天，在北，或日波利天。 此九天皆是梵炁，又即是始青天及太霄等天别名也。 并附见于此。 东方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 南方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 西方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 北方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 东北无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 东南无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 西南无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 西北无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 上方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 下方无极飞天神王长生大圣无量度人。 自东为始，乃至十方，道炁分形，其妙难测。 此则飞天大圣无极神王之尊号。 神王继元始而生，自龙汉之前，元始开化，首布此神，俾执持天炁，领括天仙，总御生死，洞理阴符，抚掌兆民。 凡劫运终、则神王陶铸学人，行保举事，凡升降之格，悉皆所系。 颂曰： 法身本自无异相，化现十方元一样。 只缘大圣能长生，度人所以无边量。 十方至真、飞天神王、长生度世无量大神，并乘飞云，丹舆绿辇，羽盖琼轮，骖驾朱凤，五色玄龙，建九色之节，十绝灵旛。 前啸九凤齐唱，后吹八鸾同呜。 狮子、白鹤，啸歌做邕邕，五老启途，群仙翼辕。 亿乘万骑，俘空而来，倾光回驾，监真度生。 舆辇轮盖皆阳精之炁所成，凤鸟龙鹤乃阴精之炁所化。 上圣之人具真常之道； 呼吸合散，随意现前。 阴阳之炁调谐成歌成曲，皆纯真所为，非外物也。 人能修炼灵宝内成，阴魔屏尽，齐集阳神，以会炼真之府。 其元炁一呼，万神咸听，五脏神灵，各随方色自现，舆辇仪卫来迎。 然后百骸众神，前导后从，升举朝元，与斯无异也。 颂曰： 纷纭仙仗贵难胜，杂还笙歌尽不成。 此个风光谁使得，大都不离自家身。 济度生死一百五十八言。 前者设象，示劝修真，今当济生拔死，以彰载度之事。 参校曰：此青元注经，条分八事之二也。 诸天丞相、南昌上宫、韩司主录、监生大神，执箓把籍，齐到帝前，随所应度， 严校诸天。 三十二天各有丞相，乃天中宰协侍宸，主录勒籍之司也。 南昌即丹天世界朱陵火府，迁化学人，炼度之所也。 韩司即宫中文人，主炼度文籍之事。 监生主生魂铸魄，更生之别名也。 感天尊愿力，各持录籍，齐到帝前，校其应受度者，或以宿名玄图，骨相合仙； 或修斋奉戒，功德积感； 或以敬奉三宝，善功彻天； 或供养师宝，为三官所。 称名在诸天者，各为严行考校，然后据功量品而升度之。 颂曰： 感召诸天集帝庭，区区校录有何因。 世间积善功高者，便有南昌炼度人。 普告三界、无极神乡、泉曲之府、北都罗酆三官九署，十二河源，上解祖考亿劫种亲疾除罪簿，落灭恶根，不得拘留逼合鬼群，元始符命时刻升迁。 三界，天、地、水也。 无极神乡，尽三界中神庭社庙之司也。 泉曲在北溟之最下，为江海之要府，皆停录罪魂之处。 北都罗酆者，自清炁上为诸天之外，其重浊之炁凝成此山，在天地之北，山高五亿五万五千五百里，周回三万里。 上参碧落，下际风泉，黑郁之炁盘砖。 其中山有六天洞宫，一日纣绝阴天宫，二日奉杀谅事宗天宫，三日明晨耐犯武城天宫，四日恬照罪炁天宫，五日宗灵七非天宫，六日敢司连宛天宫，每一宫各有一大魔王主之，为三元之总辖，五岳之都司。
chunks.translated_text:
Ninth: Non-Thought, Non-Attachment, Non-Desire Heaven, in the north, also called Pali Heaven. These Nine Heavens are all of Brahmā qi, and are also alternate names for the Primordial Azure Heaven and the Great Empyrean and other heavens, all appended here for reference.

In the eastern direction: Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Longevity Great Sage, Immeasurable Deliverer of Beings.
In the southern direction: Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Longevity Great Sage, Immeasurable Deliverer of Beings.
In the western direction: Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Longevity Great Sage, Immeasurable Deliverer of Beings.
In the northern direction: Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Longevity Great Sage, Immeasurable Deliverer of Beings.
In the northeastern direction: Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Longevity Great Sage, Immeasurable Deliverer of Beings.
In the southeastern direction: Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Longevity Great Sage, Immeasurable Deliverer of Beings.
In the southwestern direction: Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Longevity Great Sage, Immeasurable Deliverer of Beings.
In the northwestern direction: Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Longevity Great Sage, Immeasurable Deliverer of Beings.
Above: Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Longevity Great Sage, Immeasurable Deliverer of Beings.
Below: Limitless Flying Heavenly Divine King, Longevity Great Sage, Immeasurable Deliverer of Beings.

Beginning from the east and extending through the ten directions, the Dao qi divides its forms, its wonders unfathomable. These are the honorific titles of the Flying Heavenly Great Sage, Limitless Divine Kings. The Divine Kings succeed the Primordial Beginning and are born; since before the Dragon Han kalpa, when the Primordial Beginning first spread transformation, these deities were first established to grasp and uphold the heavenly qi, to oversee and encompass the heavenly immortals, to govern life and death, to thoroughly regulate the tally of yin, and to protect the myriad people. Whenever a kalpic cycle ends, the Divine Kings mold and refine the cultivators, conducting the work of recommending and promoting them; all standards for ascent and descent are entirely under their charge.

The ode says:
The Dharmakāya is originally without distinct form,
Yet manifests in the ten directions, fundamentally the same.
Only because the Great Sage can attain longevity,
Does the deliverance of beings become boundlessly immeasurable.

The perfected of the ten directions, the Flying Heavenly Divine Kings, the Longevity Deliverers of the World, Immeasurable Great Spirits, all ride upon flying clouds, cinnabar chariots and green palanquins, feathered canopies and jade wheels, drawn by crimson phoenixes and five-colored dark dragons, bearing nine-colored standards and ten mystic pennants. Ahead, nine phoenixes cry in unison; behind, eight luan-birds sing in harmony. Lions and white cranes chant and sing in concord, while the Five Elders clear the path and the host of immortals flank the procession. With a hundred thousand chariots and ten thousand riders, they arrive through the void, turning their radiant carriages to oversee the deliverance of the true and the salvation of the living. The chariots, wheels, and canopies are all formed from the qi of yang essence; the phoenixes, dragons, and cranes are transformations of the qi of yin essence. The supremely sagely, possessing the Dao of true constancy, can gather and disperse their breath at will, manifesting as they please. The harmonious qi of yin and yang forms songs and melodies, all the work of pure truth, not of external things. If one can cultivate and refine the numinous treasure within, banishing all yin demons and assembling the yang spirit, one will meet at the palace of refined truth. With a single exhalation of primordial qi, the myriad spirits all heed; the spirits of the five viscera each manifest in their directional colors, and chariots, palanquins, and attendants come to welcome. Then the hundred bones and host of spirits, leading and following, ascend to pay homage to the origin—no different from this.

The ode says:
The splendid and profuse divine retinue is of unmatched nobility,
Yet the blended reed-pipe songs all form no discord.
Who brings about this scene of splendor?
In truth, it is none other than one’s own self.

One hundred fifty-eight words on delivering from life and death. Earlier, symbols were established to encourage the cultivation of truth; now, the salvation of the living and deliverance from death shall be carried out to manifest the work of universal deliverance.

Collated and noted: This is the second of eight sections in the Azure Primordial’s annotated sutra.

The chancellors of the various heavens, the Divine Overseer of the Southern Prosperity Upper Palace, the Han Controller of Records, and the Great Spirit Who Supervises Birth, holding registers and ledgers, all assemble before the Emperor. According to those who ought to be delivered, they strictly examine the various heavens. Each of the Thirty-Two Heavens has its own chancellor, who assists the celestial sovereign and serves as the office that records and maintains the ledgers. The Southern Prosperity is the Cinnabar Heaven realm and the Vermilion Numinous Fire Mansion, the place where cultivators are transformed and refined after their transition. The Han Controller is the scribe within the palace, responsible for the records of refinement and deliverance. The Supervisor of Birth is another name for the one who forges the hun-soul and po-soul, overseeing rebirth. Moved by the vow-power of the Heavenly Worthy, each holds their registers and ledgers, assembling before the Emperor to examine those who ought to receive deliverance: some by their innate names in the mysterious charts, their bone configurations matching those of immortals; some by their cultivation of fasts and observance of precepts, their accumulated merit and virtue moving the heavens; some by their reverence for the Three Treasures, their good works penetrating the heavens; or by their offerings to the Teacher-Treasure, recorded by the Three Officials. Those whose names are proclaimed in the various heavens are each strictly examined and assessed, then promoted and delivered according to the measure of their merit.

The ode says:
The summoning of the various heavens to assemble in the imperial court—
For what reason are these meticulous examinations and records made?
Those in the world who accumulate goodness and amass great merit
Will have the refining and deliverance of the Southern Prosperity.

A universal announcement to the Three Realms, the Limitless Divine Regions, the Yellow Springs and Crooked Springs Mansion, the Northern Capital of Fengdu, the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus, and the Twelve River Sources: may the karmic debts of ancestors and parents from a hundred kalpas be absolved, their ledgers of transgressions expunged, their evil roots eradicated. They must not be detained or coerced into joining the ghostly multitudes; by the talismanic command of the Primordial Beginning, they shall be promoted and transferred at the appointed hour.

The Three Realms are Heaven, Earth, and Water. The Limitless Divine Regions encompass all the divine courts and shrines within the Three Realms. The Yellow Springs and Crooked Springs lie at the lowest depths of the northern abyss, serving as the key repository for the rivers and seas, where the ledgers of sinful souls are stored. The Northern Capital of Fengdu: beyond the heavens formed by the ascending pure qi, the congealing of turbid qi gives rise to this mountain, located in the north of the cosmos. The mountain stands five hundred fifty-five thousand five hundred li high, with a circumference of thirty thousand li. Its summit reaches the azure vault, and its base touches the wind and springs; the black and murky qi coils about it. Within the mountain are the six celestial cavern-palaces: first, the Palace of the Yin of Utter Destruction; second, the Palace of the Sect of Truthful Punishment; third, the Palace of the City of Martial Endurance; fourth, the Palace of the Qi of Sinful Calm; fifth, the Palace of the Seven Transgressions of the Ancestral Numen; sixth, the Palace of the Daring Controller of the Winding Abyss. Each palace is governed by a great demon king, who serves as the overarching authority of the Three Primes and the central office of the Five Marchmounts.

chunks.original_text: 又有三宫，上元宫在山之阿，去天为近。 天官领之主校功录善，升降品秩。 中元宫在山之左，地官领之，中有灵狱，主治罪魂，为追呼之府也。 下元宫在山之右，去风垒近，水官领之。 下有九囚大狱，寒水之庭，八难之场，主治世间恶逆重罪囚鬼。 此三宫各有三府，府有一百二十冥曹，尽酆都界官史，总九万九千九百万众，皆以世间明灵者为之。 九署者，即九垒土皇、九令之司也。 十二河源者，如导岍导嶓之类，乃分治罪魂之所。 今天尊既命诸天严行检校，升度学人，又下九龙符命，普告三元，使为学人上解祖考亿劫已来种识支亲，速为削除罪籍，落灭三恶之根，不得拘留滞碍，逼合於囚鬼之群。 应时刻而升迁也。 颂曰： 谛观符命自谁宣，能释幽牢罪苦缠。 返本还元扶起命，人人时刻得升迁。 北都寒池，部卫形魂，制魔保举，度品南宫。 死魂受炼，仙化成人，生身受度，劫劫长存。 随劫轮转，与天齐年。 酆都洞阴之境，有朔单郁绝之都，五灵玄老五、炁天君主之。 九地之中，北阴天君主之； 九水之中，太溟水帝主之； 总号曰北都。 中有三界大魔、三五将军、六甲掾吏、五帝考官，又有孰罚神兵、巨天力士万人，皆司校罪魂名籍之神也。 夫人在世，修学浅薄，而罪器深重者，不免归此。 其生也为阳魂，其死也为阴魄。 若妄源不息，则阴魂散乱，莫可执持。 故令部卫其形，使不散坏，制御群魔，令行保举，度品於南宫，使彼死魂受大火炼，鬼质消尽，然后羽化成仙。 死魂受炼者，谓血肉更生，非但父母所生之身，盖道身也。 故云生身，此之道身，一蒙仙度，则随劫流转，与天齐年也。 颂曰： 形魂只要我扶持，制得群魔不受欺。 这个生身须自度，待他保举恐成迟。 永度三途五苦八难，超凌三界，逍遥上清。 上清之天，天帝玉真无色之境梵行。 三途者，谓地狱、鬼趣、旁生。 五苦者，谓刀山、剑树之属，在世则生、老、贫、病、死。 八难者，谓堕落异类，生为下贱，形容不正，生在边方，禀性凶戾； 不遇仁君，常值兵火，与一切善自生魔障。 故《三途五苦经》云：三业净则不堕三途。 谓身、心、口。 也。 由此三业为十恶根，为众业本心。 业净则地狱无有，口业净则鬼气清消，身业净则不生异趣。 去五毒，则除五苦。 谓眼观五色，鼻嗅五香，舌了五味，耳听五音，心生五欲。 但使一根一尘清净，则五苦恶道从何而起？ 当自泯矣。 修八行则消八难，谓仁慈、孝敬、忠信、清廉、和柔、忍辱、奉戒、平等，由此八行，为万善根度世之本也。 或以八难为地狱囚闭之事，此则滞境，不该至理，宜从此义。 上清者，乃玉帝之都，大道无色之境。 梵行者，法也，谓有法可修，有行可进，故称梵行。 凡死魂受度，拜谒帝京，然后随功各升彼天，次第修习。 颂曰： 罪垢皆由心境昏，三途五苦累形魂。 天光一洗根尘净，仙化朝元礼至尊。 品述诸天四百一十三言。 前者令下三界根括生死，升度学人； 次当敷迷诸天升降品格，以示进修地位。 参校曰：此青元注经，条分八事之三也。 东方八天 元始积九阳梵炁以成，故应东方六天，为欲界二天。 为色界黄曾天，在虚梵之首宿，次奎璧。 唯余七天宿，次斗、牛、女、虚、危、室、璧。
chunks.translated_text:
Moreover, there are three palaces:

The Upper Prime Palace rests upon the mountain’s flank, nearest to Heaven. The Celestial Bureau oversees it, charged with reviewing merits, recording good deeds, and promoting or demoting ranks.

The Middle Prime Palace lies to the mountain’s left, governed by the Terrestrial Bureau. Within it stands the Spirit Prison, where guilty souls are judged and summoned to account.

The Lower Prime Palace stands to the mountain’s right, close to the Wind Ramparts, under the jurisdiction of the Aquatic Bureau. Beneath it stretch the Nine Great Prisons of the Frigid Waters, the Courts of the Eight Tribulations, where the world’s most heinous and rebellious sinners are confined.

Each of these three palaces contains three bureaus, and each bureau comprises one hundred twenty nether-offices. All officials within the bounds of Mount Fengdu number ninety-nine million nine hundred ninety-nine thousand, all chosen from among the world’s most enlightened spirits.

The Nine Departments are the Nine Ramparts of the Earth Sovereigns and the Nine Command Offices. The Twelve River Sources—such as the guiding of Mount Qian and Mount Bo—serve as the places where guilty souls are divided and judged.

Now the Heavenly Venerable has commanded all heavens to strictly examine and promote the adepts. He has also issued the Nine Dragon Talismanic Decrees, universally proclaiming to the Three Primes, ordering that for the adepts, the sins of their ancestors and collateral kin from kalpas past be swiftly expunged from the registers, the roots of the Three Evil Realms eradicated, and no lingering obstructions allowed to bind them to the ranks of imprisoned ghosts. Thus, they shall be promoted at once.

A hymn says:
Who proclaims the talismanic decree?
It releases the dark prisons’ suffering bonds.
Returning to the root, restoring the origin, it revives destiny—
Each person, at every moment, ascends.

The Northern Capital’s Frigid Pool marshals and guards the forms and souls, restrains demons, ensures protection and promotion, and ranks them for the Southern Palace. The dead souls undergo refinement; through immortal transformation, they become human. Those who receive the living-body liberation endure kalpa after kalpa, everlasting. As kalpas turn, they share Heaven’s years.

Within the yin realm of Mount Fengdu lies the Capital of Solitary Darkness and Utter Desolation, governed by the Five Numinous Elders of the Five Qi Heavenly Lords. Amid the Nine Earths, the Northern Yin Heavenly Lord presides; amid the Nine Waters, the Great Abyssal Water Emperor rules. Together, they are called the Northern Capital. There dwell the Three Realms’ Great Demons, the Three-Five Generals, the Six Jia Officials, the Five Thearchs’ Examiners, as well as the Punitive Divine Soldiers and the Ten Thousand Mighty Heavenly Warriors—all deities who oversee the registers of guilty souls.

Those in the world who cultivate shallowly yet bear deep karmic burdens cannot avoid returning here. In life, they are yang souls; in death, they become yin spirits. If their deluded roots remain unsevered, their yin souls scatter and dissolve, impossible to grasp. Thus, their forms are marshaled and guarded to prevent dissolution, demons are restrained, and protection and promotion are ensured. They are ranked in the Southern Palace, where the dead souls undergo the Great Fire’s refinement. Their ghostly substance is consumed entirely, and then they are feather-transformed into immortals.

The “dead souls undergoing refinement” refers to the rebirth of flesh and blood—not merely the body born of parents, but the Dao-body. Thus, it is called the “living body.” Once this Dao-body receives immortal liberation, it turns with the kalpas and shares Heaven’s years.

A hymn says:
The form and soul need only my support;
Restrain the demons, and they will not deceive.
This living body must liberate itself—
To wait for their protection would be too late.

Eternally liberating from the Three Paths, the Five Sufferings, and the Eight Tribulations, transcending the Three Realms, and roaming freely in the Highest Clarity.

The Heaven of Highest Clarity is the Jade Thearch’s realm, the colorless realm of Brahman conduct. The Three Paths refer to hell, the ghost realm, and the animal realm. The Five Sufferings include the knife mountains and sword trees, as well as the worldly sufferings of birth, aging, poverty, sickness, and death. The Eight Tribulations refer to falling into alien forms, being born lowly, having misshapen features, living in borderlands, possessing violent natures, not encountering a benevolent ruler, constantly facing war and fire, and all manner of karmic obstructions arising from good deeds.

Thus, the *Scripture of the Three Paths and Five Sufferings* states: “When the three karmas are pure, one does not fall into the Three Paths.” These are the body, mind, and speech. From these three karmas arise the ten evils’ roots, the source of all karma. When karma is pure, hell ceases to exist; when speech is pure, ghostly qi dissipates; when the body is pure, one is not reborn in alien realms. Abandoning the five poisons eliminates the Five Sufferings. The five poisons are the eye beholding the five colors, the nose smelling the five fragrances, the tongue savoring the five flavors, the ear hearing the five sounds, and the mind generating the five desires. If even one sense and one dust are purified, from where could the Five Sufferings and evil paths arise? They would naturally vanish.

Cultivating the Eight Practices dissolves the Eight Tribulations. These are benevolence, filial piety, loyalty, trustworthiness, integrity, gentleness, forbearance, precept-keeping, and equanimity. From these Eight Practices arise the roots of all virtues and the foundation for transcending the world. Some interpret the Eight Tribulations as the affairs of imprisonment in hell, but this is a limited view, not encompassing the ultimate principle. The correct understanding lies here.

The Highest Clarity is the Jade Thearch’s capital, the colorless realm of the Great Dao. Brahman conduct refers to the Dharma—there are methods to cultivate and practices to advance, hence it is called Brahman conduct. When dead souls receive liberation, they pay homage to the Imperial Capital, then ascend to their respective heavens according to merit, progressing step by step in cultivation.

A hymn says:
All defilements arise from the mind’s dimness;
The Three Paths and Five Sufferings burden the form and soul.
When the Heavenly Light washes away the roots and dusts,
Immortal transformation faces the origin and pays homage to the Supreme.

This section describes the ranks of the four hundred thirteen heavens.

Previously, the decree was issued to the Three Realms to root out life and death and promote the adepts. Next, the ranks of ascent and descent among the various heavens shall be expounded, to demonstrate the stages of progress in cultivation.

A note on collation: This is the third of eight sections in the *Blue Prime’s Annotated Scripture*.

The Eastern Eight Heavens: The Primordial Beginning accumulated the nine yang Brahman qi to form them. Thus, they correspond to the Eastern Six Heavens, comprising the two heavens of the Desire Realm and the Yellow Top Heaven of the Form Realm, which stands at the head of the Void Brahman’s constellations, next to Kui and Bi. The remaining seven heavens’ constellations follow: Dipper, Ox, Girl, Void, Rooftop, House, and Wall.

chunks.original_text: 参校曰：别本注帝服，青冕、青蔬、青服、青裳六天为欲界。 ○清浊分九阳，一轻之炁成天，在众天之下，去凡五百二十亿万里，乃风霄之界。 世人行三净行，建百善功者，得生此天。 天人寿命不等，初出凡界，欲染未除，故天中之人有形可见。 其间或以接手为欲，或以言辞、或以眼视、或以身交，故云欲界。 此天快乐，绝胜诸天，故多贪着，衰相易现，寿命终尽，则复沦诸趣。 若渐次修习，欲染顿除，则升入色界。 修小乘道可以证此，谓之天人。 释经所谓修六度，行初进之侣。 天中具有太清三百六十科戒，检制天人，如大劫交大火，自昆仑根起，梵烧世界，炎焰上升，直至和阳天，於是元炁溃散，天乃沦坏。 颂曰： 珠阙琼楼是欲根，嫔娥彩丽奏天钧。

A note on collation: Another edition annotates the imperial vestments, with the six heavens of the Desire Realm being the Azure Crown, Azure Robe, Azure Garment, and Azure Skirts. ○ The nine yang are divided into pure and turbid; the qi of singular lightness forms the heavens, which lie beneath the host of heavens, fifty-two billion myriad leagues from the mortal realm, at the boundary of the Wind Firmament. Those who practice the Threefold Purity and establish the merit of a hundred virtues are reborn in these heavens. The lifespans of the heavenly beings vary; newly ascended from the mortal realm, their defilements of desire are not yet extinguished, and thus the inhabitants of these heavens possess visible forms. Among them, some regard clasping hands as desire, others words or glances, still others bodily union—hence the name Desire Realm. The bliss of these heavens surpasses all others, and thus many cling to it greedily; signs of decline readily appear, and when their lifespans end, they sink once more into the various destinies. If they gradually cultivate and suddenly extinguish the defilements of desire, they ascend into the Form Realm. Practicing the Lesser Vehicle’s Way may realize this state, known as heavenly beings. As the sutras say: those who cultivate the Six Perfections and walk the path of initial progress. These heavens possess the Three Hundred Sixty Precepts of Grand Purity to restrain their inhabitants. When the great kalpa’s fire arises from the roots of Kunlun, the world is scorched by Brahman flames, and the conflagration ascends to the Harmony Yang Heaven; there, the primordial qi dissolves, and the heavens collapse.

A hymn says:
Jade towers and pearl pavilions are the roots of desire,
Fair maidens and radiant beauties play celestial melodies.

chunks.original_text: 但将爱处休耽染，项背圆光转转明。 太皇黄曾天， 异号净天，或称睹史。 其色黄，应东一方，宿次奎璧。 世人修十善功，初出凡者，得生此天。 帝郁鉴玉明。 郁缢，天帝觉之内讳； 玉明，帝魔之隐音。 云篆太虚之文，元始以玉简金书秘于天之紫极官。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主长生箓。 太明玉完天， 或称胜妙天，色绿，应东方，宿次璧。 世人建二十善功，二根净者，生此天。 帝须阿那田。 须阿，天王内文； 那田，天王隐音。 四字金书秘之于天之紫房宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主度魂更生。 清明何童天， 异号光天，其色黑，应东方，宿次室。 世人建四十善功，三根净者，生此天。 帝元育齐京。 元育，天王之隐讳。 齐京，真人内文。 四字金书秘于天之九晨宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主敷布政教，度脱天人也。 玄胎平育天， 异号梵天，或称忉利，其色赤，应东方，宿次危。 世人建六十善功，四根净者，生此天。 帝刘度内鲜。 即天帝君之隐名，四字金书秘于天之元景宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主召魔举仙。 元明文举天， 或云化乐，其色苍，应东方，宿次虚。 世人建八十善功，五根净者，得生此天。 帝丑法轮。 丑，天君内文。 法轮，帝之异号。 三字金书秘于天之广寒宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主通行元炁。 上明七曜摩夷天， 异号化乐，谓欲乐之极，其色黑，应东方，宿次女。 世人修一百善功，六根净者，得生于此天。 帝恬烩　乌外切　延。 恬懀，天帝内音，延为隐号。 三字金书秘于天之太阴宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主开度幽难。 一十八天为色界。 ○清浊分轻清之炁以成其色，不同在元色之下，去欲界三十万里，乃丹霞之景。 鹿尘六天修下元三百戒，积三百善功者，乃升此天。 细尘六天，修中元五百戒，积七百善功者，升之。 轻尘六天，修上元七百戒，积八百善功者升之。 虽无情欲，尚有形色可见，故云色界。 若渐次修习，尘染顿尽，形色不升，则转入无色界。 若生贪着、则复坠下天。 修中乘道可以证此，谓之天仙。 其上者谓真仙。 释名四果天中具有上清二百四十科戒，检制天人，如大劫交水，自东井起，洪泉鼓波，漂荡世界，直望极风天，元炁溃散，此天沦坏。 颂曰： 勤修功行始超尘，快乐宫中享大椿。

Should one but cease to indulge in attachments,
The halo behind the nape grows ever brighter.

The Supreme August Yellow-Presence Heaven,
Also called the Pure Heaven or the Witnessing History Heaven,
Is yellow in hue, corresponding to the eastern quadrant,
Its asterisms aligned with Legs and Wall.
Those who cultivate the Ten Virtues’ merit,
Emerging from the mundane for the first time,
Are reborn in this heaven.
Its sovereign is Yu Jian-Yu Ming:
*Yu Yi* is the inner taboo name of the Heavenly Thearch;
*Yu Ming* is the hidden title of the Demon Emperor.
The cloud-seal script of the Great Void,
Inscribed in jade slips and golden characters,
Is secreted within the Purple Ultimate Palace of Heaven.

Variant collation: Another edition annotates: *The Thearch presides over the Register of Longevity.*

The Grand Clarity Jade-Perfection Heaven,
Also called the Supreme Wondrous Heaven,
Is green in hue, corresponding to the eastern quadrant,
Its asterisms aligned with Wall.
Those who establish the Twenty Virtues’ merit,
With two roots purified,
Are reborn in this heaven.
Its sovereign is Xu A-Na Tian:
*Xu A* is the inner script of the Heavenly King;
*Na Tian* is the hidden title of the Heavenly King.
The four characters, inscribed in gold,
Are secreted within the Purple Chamber Palace of Heaven.

Variant collation: Another edition annotates: *The Thearch presides over the deliverance of souls for rebirth.*

The Luminous Ho-Tong Heaven,
Also called the Radiant Heaven,
Is black in hue, corresponding to the eastern quadrant,
Its asterisms aligned with House.
Those who establish the Forty Virtues’ merit,
With three roots purified,
Are reborn in this heaven.
Its sovereign is Yuan Yu-Qi Jing:
*Yuan Yu* is the hidden taboo of the Heavenly King;
*Qi Jing* is the inner script of the Perfected.
The four characters, inscribed in gold,
Are secreted within the Nine Dawns Palace of Heaven.

Variant collation: Another edition annotates: *The Thearch presides over the promulgation of governance and teachings, delivering heavenly beings.*

The Mysterious Womb Level-Nurturing Heaven,
Also called the Brahmā Heaven or the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven,
Is red in hue, corresponding to the eastern quadrant,
Its asterisms aligned with Rooftop.
Those who establish the Sixty Virtues’ merit,
With four roots purified,
Are reborn in this heaven.
Its sovereign is Liu Du-Nei Xian:
A hidden name of the Heavenly Thearch,
The four characters, inscribed in gold,
Are secreted within the Primordial Scenery Palace of Heaven.

Variant collation: Another edition annotates: *The Thearch presides over the summoning of demons and the elevation of immortals.*

The Primordial Clarity Literary Elevation Heaven,
Also called the Transformation-Delight Heaven,
Is azure in hue, corresponding to the eastern quadrant,
Its asterisms aligned with Emptiness.
Those who establish the Eighty Virtues’ merit,
With five roots purified,
Are reborn in this heaven.
Its sovereign is Chou Fa-Lun:
*Chou* is the inner script of the Heavenly Lord;
*Fa-Lun* is the alternate title of the Thearch.
The three characters, inscribed in gold,
Are secreted within the Vast Cold Palace of Heaven.

Variant collation: Another edition annotates: *The Thearch presides over the circulation of primordial qi.*

The Upper Clarity Seven Luminaries Māyā Heaven,
Also called the Transformation-Delight Heaven—
Here, delight in desire reaches its zenith—
Is black in hue, corresponding to the eastern quadrant,
Its asterisms aligned with Woman.
Those who cultivate the Hundred Virtues’ merit,
With six roots purified,
Are reborn in this heaven.
Its sovereign is Tian Hui-Yan:
*Tian Hui* is the inner sound of the Heavenly Thearch;
*Yan* is the hidden title.
The three characters, inscribed in gold,
Are secreted within the Grand Yin Palace of Heaven.

Variant collation: Another edition annotates: *The Thearch presides over the deliverance of those in hidden distress.*

The Eighteen Heavens constitute the Form Realm.
Here, the clear and turbid qi, refined into subtle clarity,
Form their hues, distinct from the formless below.
Thirty myriad leagues above the Desire Realm,
Amidst the cinnabar mists’ splendor,
Those of the Six Dust Heavens who observe the Three Hundred Precepts of the Lower Primordial,
Accumulating three hundred virtues’ merit,
Ascend to these heavens.
Those of the Fine Dust Heavens who observe the Five Hundred Precepts of the Middle Primordial,
Accumulating seven hundred virtues’ merit,
Ascend to these heavens.
Those of the Light Dust Heavens who observe the Seven Hundred Precepts of the Upper Primordial,
Accumulating eight hundred virtues’ merit,
Ascend to these heavens.
Though free from passionate desire,
They still possess visible forms and hues—
Hence, the Form Realm.
Should one gradually cultivate and suddenly extinguish the dust-like defilements,
So that form and hue no longer arise,
One enters the Formless Realm.
If attachment arises, one may yet fall back to the lower heavens.
Practicing the Middle Vehicle’s Way may realize this state,
Known as Heavenly Immortals.
The loftiest among them are called Perfected Immortals.
As the *Names of the Four Fruits* states:
The heavens possess the Two Hundred Forty Precepts of Upper Clarity
To restrain their inhabitants.
When the great kalpa’s flood arises from the Eastern Well,
Mighty springs churn the waves,
Inundating the world,
Rising to the Ultimate Wind Heaven,
Where the primordial qi dissolves,
And these heavens collapse.

A hymn says:
Through diligent cultivation of merit and conduct, one first transcends the dust,
In the Palace of Bliss, enjoying the great camphor tree.

The heart-mirror, a single wheel, diligently wipe and polish;
Adorn the floral crown, ensure it does not tilt or lean.
Beyond the Void, transcending the Heng Heaven,
Some call it the First Brahma Heaven, its hue azure,
Corresponding to the East, in the lunar mansion of Ox.
Though the six senses of the heavenly beings are pure,
They remain bound by the dust of form,
Thus ascending to this heaven.
It is also named the First Dhyāna Heaven.
The Emperor is Zheng Ding Guang.
This is the inner script of the Heavenly Emperor,
The three golden characters secretly enshrined in the Heavenly Great Mystery Palace.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the Supreme Dao."

The Primordial Obscurity Heaven,
Some call it the Upper Brahma Heaven, its hue purple,
Corresponding to the East, in the lunar mansion of Dipper.
The heavenly beings here are of one form, the dust of form purified,
Thus ascending to this heaven, also named the First Dhyāna Heaven.
The Emperor is Qu Yu Jiu Chang.
Qu Yu is the hidden title of the Heavenly King;
Jiu Chang is the Emperor’s general script.
The four golden characters are secretly enshrined in the Heavenly Mystery Capital Palace.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the refinement and deliverance of decayed remains."

The Eight Heavens of the South
Are formed by the Primordial Beginning’s accumulation of triple yang Brahma qi,
Thus corresponding to the South, governed by the Great Clarity qi,
With the Most High Lord Lao as the transforming sovereign.
The Vermilion Brightness Heaven stands at the forefront of the Void Brahma Heavens,
In the lunar mansions of Winnowing Basket and Dipper.
The remaining seven heavens reside in the lunar mansions of Horn, Neck, Root, Chamber, Heart, Tail, and Winnowing Basket.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor wears a blue crown, red pendants, vermilion robes, and yellow skirts."

The Vermilion Brightness Harmony Yang Heaven,
Also called Lesser Light, its hue white,
Corresponding to the South, in the lunar mansions of Winnowing Basket and Dipper.
The heavenly beings here have purified two forms of dust,
Thus ascending to this heaven, also named the First Dhyāna Heaven.
The Emperor is Li Jin Shang Zhen.
These four characters are the hidden title of the Heavenly King,
Secretly inscribed in golden script within the Heavenly Eternal Brightness Palace.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the refinement of immortals into Perfected Ones."

The Mysterious Brightness Reverent Splendor Heaven,
Also called Resounding Light, its hue yellow,
Corresponding to the South, in the lunar mansion of Winnowing Basket.
The heavenly beings here have purified three forms of dust,
Thus ascending to this heaven, also named the Second Dhyāna Heaven.
The Emperor is Kong Yao Chou Yin.
These four characters are the inner script of the Heavenly Lord,
Secretly inscribed in golden script within the Heavenly Eastern Florescence Palace.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the transformation and response to all things."

The Radiant Florescence Soaring Heaven,
Also called Immeasurable Light, its hue green,
Corresponding to the South, in the lunar mansion of Tail.
The heavenly beings here have purified four forms of dust,
Thus ascending to this heaven, also named the Second Dhyāna Heaven.
The Emperor is Chong Guang Ming.
These three characters are the general title of the Heavenly Emperor,
Secretly inscribed in golden script within the Heavenly Vast Mystery Palace.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the reception of those who study immortality at the kalpa’s end."

The Bamboo Grove August Reed Heaven,
Alternately named First Purity, its hue blue,
Corresponding to the South, in the lunar mansion of Heart.
The heavenly beings here have purified five forms of dust,
Thus ascending to this heaven, also named the Second Dhyāna Heaven.
The Emperor is Mo Yi Miao Bian.
Mo Yi is the Heavenly Lord’s hidden taboo;
Miao Bian is the Emperor’s inner voice.
The four golden characters are secretly enshrined in the Heavenly Azure Mystery Palace.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the demonic trials of those who study immortality."

The Void Brightness Hall Radiance Heaven,
Alternately named Severe Purity, its hue red,
Corresponding to the South, in the lunar mansion of Chamber.
The heavenly beings here have purified six forms of dust, yet subtle dust remains,
Thus ascending to this heaven, also named the Third Dhyāna Heaven.
The Emperor is A Yin Lou Sheng.
A Yin is the hidden sound of the Heavenly King;
Lou Sheng is the Brahma title of the Jade Lord.
The four golden characters are secretly enshrined in the Heavenly Double Florescence Palace.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the deliverance of humans and heavenly beings."

The Contemplative Brightness Upright Tranquility Heaven,
Alternately named Pervasive Purity, its hue gray,
Corresponding to the South, in the lunar mansion of Root.
The heavenly beings here have purified the subtle dust of one form,
Thus ascending to this heaven, also named the Third Dhyāna Heaven.
The Emperor is Yu Mi Luo Qian.
Yu Mi is the Emperor’s hidden script;
Luo Qian is the Heavenly Lord’s inner title.
The four golden characters are secretly enshrined in the Heavenly Radiant Florescence Palace.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the deliverance of the bodies of those who study the Dao."

The Mysterious Brightness Reverent Celebration Heaven,
Also called Immeasurable Purity, its hue black,
Corresponding to the South, in the lunar mansion of Neck.
The heavenly beings here have purified the subtle dust of two forms,
Thus ascending to this heaven, also named the Third Dhyāna Heaven.
The Emperor is Long Luo Bing Kou Ti.
Long Luo is the inner sound of the Flying Heavens;
Pu Ti is the hidden title of the Emperor.
The four golden characters are secretly enshrined in the Heavenly Opening and Closing Palace.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the deliverance of those who have attained the Dao."

The Great Radiance Ultimate Jade Heaven,
Alternately named Blessed Love Victory, its hue azure,
Corresponding to the South, in the lunar mansion of Horn.
The heavenly beings here have purified the subtle dust of three forms,
Thus ascending to this heaven, also named the Fourth Dhyāna Heaven.
The Emperor is Wan Li Wu Yan.
These four characters are the inner script of the Heavenly King,
Secretly inscribed in golden script within the Heavenly Imperial Peace Palace.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the instruction of those who study immortality."

The Eight Heavens of the West
Are formed by the Primordial Beginning’s accumulation of nonuple yang Brahma qi,
Thus corresponding to the West, governed by the Upper Clarity qi,
With the Most High Dao Lord as the transforming sovereign.
The Cavern Ascent Heaven stands at the forefront of the Void Brahma Heavens,
In the lunar mansions of Chariot and Horn;
The remaining seven heavens reside in the lunar mansions of Well, Ghost, Willow, Star, Spread, Wing, and Chariot.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor wears a blue crown, golden pendants, white robes, white skirts, and vermilion knee covers."

chunks.original_text: 或云快乐，其色紫，应西方，宿次轸角。 天人四细尘净，乃升此天，亦号四禅天。 帝开真定光。 开，即天帝君内音。 真定光，即天主隐讳。 四字金书秘于天之延寿官。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主炼度死魂更生。 太安皇崖天， 异号极乐，其色白，应西方，宿次轸。 天人五细尘净，乃升此天，亦号四禅天。 帝婆娄阿贪。 婆娄，天君隐音； 阿贪，帝魔内讳。 四字金书秘于天之开明宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主开度善人。 显定极风天， 或云广乐，其色黄，应西方，宿次翼。 天人六细尘虽净，尚余轻染，乃升此天。 亦号四禅天。 帝招真童。 三字，天君之秘号。 金书秘于天之大赤宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主度有善功之魂。 始皇孝芒天， 或云上妙，其色绿，应西方，宿次张。 天人一轻染净，乃升此天。 帝萨罗娄王。 四字，乃玉真之隐文，金书秘于天之太丹宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主披夜开幽。 太皇翁重浮容天， 或云：色究竟，其色青，应西方，宿次星。 其色尘渐除，故云色究竟。 天人二轻染净，乃升此天。 帝闵巴狂。 三字，天中帝君之内文。 金书秘于天之华盖宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主召魔集真。 无思江由天， 或号最上妙，其色赤，应西方，宿次柳。 天人三轻染净，乃升此天。 帝明梵光。 三字，天中帝君之内号。 金书秘于天之明堂宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主开度善魂。 上揲乐，音岳。 天， 或号自在，其色苍，应西方，宿次鬼。 天人四轻染净，乃升此天。 帝勃 音拂 勃 音沛 监。 勃勃乃天君内文，监乃帝之内号。 三字金书秘于天之运灵宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主品类天人等级。 无极云誓天， 异号大自在，亦云不还。 音旋。 其色黑，应西方，宿次井。 天人五轻尘净，乃升此天，天人到此，更无复坠下，故云不还。 帝飘弩穹隆。 飘弩，天魔内文； 穹隆，帝君隆讳。 四字金书秘于天之中元宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主度一切天人。 北方八天 元始积五阳梵炁以成四天，为无色界。 四天，为种民天，治属玉清炁，元始天尊为化主； 霄度天，在虚梵之首，宿次参井，唯余七天，宿次奎、娄、胃、昴、毕、觜、参。 参校曰：别本注云：帝服青冕、白旒、皂服、朱裳。 四天为无色界。 ○清浊分，清高之炁以成四天之色，纯碧，在种民之下，去色界三十六万里，乃碧霞之景。 天人尘染俱净，洞入自然，乃升此天。 身形微妙，或大或小，无复色象，人不能见，故云无色。 天中亦无日月星辰，寿量无尽，若空有两忘，结习俱尽，乃升种民。 修大乘之道，可以证此，谓之真人。 释云：菩提萨埵天中，具有玉清一百二十科戒，检制天人。 如大数交火劫，焚至和阳天； 水劫漂至极风天。
chunks.translated_text:
The term may also be rendered as "Realm of Bliss," its color purple, corresponding to the West, in the lunar mansions of Chariot and Horn. When the celestial beings’ four fine dusts are purified, they ascend to this heaven, also called the Fourth Dhyāna Heaven. The Emperor opens the True Concentration Light. "Opens" is the inner sound of the Heavenly Emperor Lord; "True Concentration Light" is the hidden name of the Heavenly Sovereign. These four characters are inscribed in gold script, concealed within the Heavenly Palace of Extended Life.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the refinement and deliverance of deceased souls for rebirth."

The Heaven of Supreme Peace and Imperial Cliff,
Also named "Ultimate Bliss," its color white, corresponding to the West, in the lunar mansion of Chariot. When the celestial beings’ five fine dusts are purified, they ascend to this heaven, also called the Fourth Dhyāna Heaven. The Emperor is named Bālou Ātān. "Bālou" is the hidden sound of the Heavenly Lord; "Ātān" is the inner name of the Emperor-Demon. These four characters are inscribed in gold script, concealed within the Heavenly Palace of Enlightenment.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the deliverance of the virtuous."

The Heaven of Manifest Concentration and Ultimate Wind,
Also called "Vast Joy," its color yellow, corresponding to the West, in the lunar mansion of Wing. Though the celestial beings’ six fine dusts are purified, they still retain subtle defilements, and thus ascend to this heaven, also called the Fourth Dhyāna Heaven. The Emperor is named Zhao Zhen Tong. These three characters are the secret title of the Heavenly Lord. They are inscribed in gold script, concealed within the Heavenly Palace of Great Crimson.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the deliverance of souls with meritorious virtue."

The Heaven of Initial Sovereignty and Filial Radiance,
Also called "Supreme Wonder," its color green, corresponding to the West, in the lunar mansion of Spread. When the celestial beings’ single subtle defilement is purified, they ascend to this heaven. The Emperor is named Sàluólóu Wáng. These four characters are the hidden script of Jade Perfection, inscribed in gold script and concealed within the Heavenly Palace of Great Cinnabar.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the revelation of the hidden and the illumination of the obscure."

The Heaven of Grand Sovereignty and Aged Floating Countenance,
Also called "Color’s Ultimate," its color blue, corresponding to the West, in the lunar mansion of Star. As their colored dusts gradually dissolve, it is called "Color’s Ultimate." When the celestial beings’ two subtle defilements are purified, they ascend to this heaven. The Emperor is named Mǐn Bā Kuáng. These three characters are the inner script of the Heavenly Emperor Lord. They are inscribed in gold script, concealed within the Heavenly Palace of Floral Canopy.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the summoning of demons and the assembly of the perfected."

The Heaven of Thought-Free River Origin,
Also named "Most Supreme Wonder," its color red, corresponding to the West, in the lunar mansion of Willow. When the celestial beings’ three subtle defilements are purified, they ascend to this heaven. The Emperor is named Míng Fàn Guāng. These three characters are the inner title of the Heavenly Emperor Lord. They are inscribed in gold script, concealed within the Heavenly Palace of Bright Hall.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the deliverance of virtuous souls."

The Heaven of Supreme Joy (pronounced *yuè*),
Also called "Freedom," its color gray, corresponding to the West, in the lunar mansion of Ghost. When the celestial beings’ four subtle defilements are purified, they ascend to this heaven. The Emperor is named Bó Bó Jiān (pronounced *fú* and *pèi* respectively). "Bóbó" is the inner script of the Heavenly Lord; "Jiān" is the inner title of the Emperor. These three characters are inscribed in gold script, concealed within the Heavenly Palace of Spirit Conduction.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the ranking of celestial beings and humans."

The Heaven of Boundless Cloud Vows,
Also called "Great Freedom" or "Non-Return" (pronounced *xuán*). Its color black, corresponding to the West, in the lunar mansion of Well. When the celestial beings’ five subtle dusts are purified, they ascend to this heaven. Upon reaching this realm, they never again descend, hence it is called "Non-Return." The Emperor is named Piāo Nǔ Qióng Lóng. "Piāo Nǔ" is the inner script of the Heavenly Demon; "Qióng Lóng" is the hidden name of the Emperor Lord. These four characters are inscribed in gold script, concealed within the Heavenly Palace of Central Origin.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor presides over the deliverance of all celestial beings."

The Eight Heavens of the North
Are formed by the Primordial Beginning’s accumulation of quintuple yang Brahma qi, constituting the Four Heavens of the Formless Realm. These Four Heavens are the Seed-People Heavens, governed by the Jade Clarity qi, with the Primordial Heavenly Worthy as the transforming sovereign. The Heaven of Cloud Ascent stands at the forefront of the Void Brahma Heavens, in the lunar mansions of Well and Orion’s Belt; the remaining seven heavens reside in the lunar mansions of Straddler, Harvester, Stomach, Hairy Head, Net, Beak, and Orion’s Belt.
Collated note: Another edition annotates: "The Emperor wears a blue crown, white pendants, black robes, and vermilion skirts."

The Four Heavens constitute the Formless Realm. The pure, lofty qi, refined from the separation of clear and turbid, forms the color of these four heavens—pure azure—situated below the Seed-People, thirty-six myriad leagues from the Form Realm. It is the radiance of azure mist. When the celestial beings’ dust defilements are entirely purified, they penetrate into the natural state and ascend to this heaven. Their forms become subtle and wondrous, now large, now small, no longer bearing color or image, invisible to others, hence it is called the Formless Realm. Within this heaven, there are no sun, moon, or stars, and their lifespans are boundless. Only when both emptiness and existence are forgotten, and all habitual tendencies are extinguished, do they ascend to the Seed-People. Those who cultivate the Great Vehicle’s Dao may realize this, and are called Perfected Beings.
Annotation: In the Bodhisattva Heaven, there are one hundred and twenty precepts of Jade Clarity to restrain and regulate the celestial beings. As in the great kalpa of fire, it burns up to the Heaven of Harmonious Yang; in the kalpa of water, it floods up to the Heaven of Ultimate Wind.

chunks.original_text: 水火到此衰绝，不能上升，相乘化合，为风扇荡於是，元炁溃散。 自孝芒至霄度六天为风所坏，自元洞以去七天，但元炁散而复合，不拘三界劫运也。 颂曰： 渐入无为得道宗，一尘不染意圆通。 回眸下视三千界，万法都来一个空。 皓庭霄度天， 异号不同，应北方，宿次参、井。 天人轻染虽净，尚余染习，乃升此天。 帝慧觉昏。 三字，帝君之内音。 金书秘于天之琼瑶官。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主拔度学人。 渊通元洞天， 异号大不空，应北方，宿次参。 天人色尘都忘，但有心识，渐入炁观，乃升此天。 帝梵行观生。 梵行，天君内音； 观生，帝之隐讳。 四字。 金书秘于天之真元宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主度学仙之人。 太文翰宠妙成天， 异号非想，应北方，宿次觜。 天人心识两忘，炁观渐妙，乃升此天。 帝那育丑瑛。 四字，天帝魔王之内文。 金书秘于天之灵幽官。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主统理魔王。 太素秀乐　音洛　禁上天， 异号非非想，应北方，宿次毕。 天人结习渐忘，炁观转妙，乃升此天。 帝龙罗觉长。 龙罗，天王内讳； 觉长，帝之隐文。 四字金书秘于天之化灵宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主领录魔王。 四天为种民天。 ○清浊分得高虚之炁以成四天之色，不同在大罗之下，去无色界一百三十五万八千里，乃太虚之景。 天人经历诸天，诸尘漏尽，一相无相，皆悉空寂，结习顿忘，洞入真道者，乃升此天。 释云：已入正修得三摩地天中，常住不灭。 多是历代圣君贤臣居之，如羲皇、周孔之属是也。 亦无禁戒，但飞行元炁，上朝九清，若积功而真妙，则升入大罗，修最上乘之道，可以证此，谓之仙圣。 如大数交，三劫大起，三界损尽，此天元炁复混为一； 圣人降生凡世，开教立法，制造万物，以度人庶。 故《生神经》云：以充种民。 此之谓也。 盖为民之种，故云种民。 颂曰： 无影无形大法身，不生不灭号成真。 几经劫石消磨尽，寂寂神光依旧明。 太虚无上常融天， 异号不动，其色绿，应北方，宿次昴。 天人初出三界，结习顿忘，尚喜无为，渐入神观，乃升此天。 帝总监 音鉴 鬼神。 乃天帝君之都讳、乃摄魔之内音。 四字金书秘于天之万福宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主校学者之功。 太释玉隆腾胜天， 异号大不动天，其色青，应北方，宿次胃。 天人喜习顿除，神观转妙，乃升此天。 帝眇眇行元。 四字，乃帝君之隐号。 金书秘于天之白盖宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主召集仙圣。 龙变梵度天， 异号上妙天，其色赤，应北方，宿次娄。 天人清净无染，证不空果，乃升此天。 帝运上玄玄。 运上，天王之内文； 玄玄，玉真之总音。 四字金书秘于天之灵宝宫。 此天别有宫阙，号曰延真。 释氏见性成佛、顿悟大乘、洞入最上乘者，乃居其中。 时游三界诸天，教诸天人菩萨，修诸梵行。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主进仙成圣。 太极平育贾　音古。 奕天， 异号最上妙，其色苍，应北方，宿次奎。 天人洞入道妙，证无上玄觉，乃升此天。 天人修习至此，号为究竟升玄，转入三境。 帝大择法门。 天王之总文，四字。 金书秘于天之天宝宫。 参校曰：别本注云：帝主普度学者之身。 三十二天，三十二帝，诸天隐讳，诸天隐名。
chunks.translated_text:
Where water and fire wane and cease, unable to ascend further, they intermingle and combine, stirred by winds that scatter the primordial qi. From Xiaomang to Xiaodu, the six heavens are destroyed by wind; from Yuandong onward, the seven heavens merely see primordial qi disperse and recombine, unbound by the kalpas of the Three Realms.

*Verse:*
Gradually entering non-action, attaining the Dao’s essence,
Not a speck of dust clings—mind perfectly pervades.
Gazing back to survey the three thousand realms,
The myriad dharmas all return to a single emptiness.

**Haoting Xiaodu Heaven**—also called by different names—corresponds to the north, aligning with the stellar mansions *Shen* and *Jing*. Though celestial beings here have purified even subtle defilements, residual habitual tendencies remain, and thus they ascend to this heaven. **Emperor Hui Awakens Darkness**—these three characters are the inner name of the Heavenly Lord, inscribed in golden script and concealed within the Heaven’s *Qiongyao* Palace.
*Collation:* An alternate text annotates: "The Emperor delivers and elevates cultivators."

**Yuantong Yuandong Heaven**—also called *Great Non-Emptiness*—corresponds to the north, aligning with the stellar mansion *Shen*. Here, celestial beings have forgotten all sensory defilements, retaining only consciousness, gradually entering qi-contemplation, and thus ascend to this heaven. **Emperor Brahma Conducts Birth-Observation**—*Brahma Conduct* is the inner name of the Heavenly Lord; *Birth-Observation* is the Emperor’s hidden title. These four characters are inscribed in golden script and concealed within the Heaven’s *Zhenyuan* Palace.
*Collation:* An alternate text annotates: "The Emperor delivers those who cultivate immortality."

**Taiwen Hanrong Miaocheng Heaven**—also called *Non-Perception*—corresponds to the north, aligning with the stellar mansion *Zui*. Here, celestial beings have forgotten both consciousness and perception, their qi-contemplation growing ever more refined, and thus they ascend to this heaven. **Emperor Nayuchou Ying**—these four characters are the inner script of the Heavenly Emperor and Demon King, inscribed in golden script and concealed within the Heaven’s *Lingyou* Palace.
*Collation:* An alternate text annotates: "The Emperor governs and oversees demon kings."

**Taisu Xiule Jin Shang Heaven**—also called *Neither-Perception-Nor-Non-Perception*—corresponds to the north, aligning with the stellar mansion *Bi*. Here, celestial beings gradually forget residual habitual tendencies, their qi-contemplation growing ever more refined, and thus they ascend to this heaven. **Emperor Long Luo Awareness-Length**—*Long Luo* is the Heavenly King’s hidden name; *Awareness-Length* is the Emperor’s concealed script. These four characters are inscribed in golden script and concealed within the Heaven’s *Hualing* Palace.
*Collation:* An alternate text annotates: "The Emperor records and oversees demon kings."

These four heavens constitute the **Seed-People Heavens**. Pure and turbid qi divide to form the colors of these four heavens, distinct from those beneath the Great Luo. They lie one million three hundred fifty-eight thousand *li* beyond the Formless Realm, within the vista of the Great Void. Only those celestial beings who, having traversed all heavens and extinguished all sensory leaks, attain the formless and the formless itself—all utterly quiescent—suddenly forget all habitual tendencies and penetrate the true Dao, ascend to these heavens.
*Annotation:* Within the heavens of right cultivation and attainment of *samādhi*, they abide eternally unperishing. Mostly inhabited by sagely sovereigns and worthy ministers of past ages—such as Fuxi and the Zhou Confucius—there are no prohibitions here. They soar upon primordial qi, ascending to pay homage to the Nine Purities. If their accumulated merits attain true subtlety, they ascend into the Great Luo, cultivating the supreme vehicle’s Dao, and are called **Immortal Sages**. When the great kalpas converge and the three disasters arise, the Three Realms are utterly destroyed, yet the primordial qi of these heavens recombines as one. The sages descend into the mortal world to inaugurate teachings, establish laws, and create the myriad things to deliver the multitudes. Thus, the *Scripture of Spirit-Generation* states: "To replenish the seed-people." This is the meaning. As they are the seed of the people, they are called *Seed-People*.

*Verse:*
Formless and shapeless, the great Dharma-body,
Neither born nor extinguished, called *Perfected Truth*.
Though kalpas wear even stone to naught,
The numinous radiance remains, silent and bright.

**Taixu Wushang Changrong Heaven**—also called *Immovable*—its color is green, corresponding to the north, aligning with the stellar mansion *Mao*. Here, celestial beings, having just exited the Three Realms, suddenly forget all habitual tendencies, delighting in non-action and gradually entering spirit-contemplation, ascend to this heaven. **Emperor Overseer of Ghosts and Spirits**—these are the Heavenly Emperor Lord’s primary hidden name and the inner sound that subdues demons. These four characters are inscribed in golden script and concealed within the Heaven’s *Wanfu* Palace.
*Collation:* An alternate text annotates: "The Emperor examines the merits of cultivators."

**Tai Shi Yulong Tengsheng Heaven**—also called *Great Immovable Heaven*—its color is azure, corresponding to the north, aligning with the stellar mansion *Wei*. Here, celestial beings suddenly cast off all habitual tendencies, their spirit-contemplation growing ever more refined, and thus they ascend to this heaven. **Emperor Miaomiao Xingyuan**—these four characters are the Emperor Lord’s hidden title, inscribed in golden script and concealed within the Heaven’s *Baigai* Palace.
*Collation:* An alternate text annotates: "The Emperor summons and gathers immortals and sages."

**Longbian Fandu Heaven**—also called *Supreme Wondrous Heaven*—its color is crimson, corresponding to the north, aligning with the stellar mansion *Lou*. Here, celestial beings, utterly pure and undefiled, realize the fruit of non-emptiness, and thus ascend to this heaven. **Emperor Yun Shang Xuanyuan**—*Yun Shang* is the Heavenly King’s inner script; *Xuanyuan* is the Jade Perfected’s general sound. These four characters are inscribed in golden script and concealed within the Heaven’s *Lingbao* Palace. This heaven possesses separate palaces called *Yanzhen*. Those of the Buddhist tradition who see their nature and become Buddhas, suddenly awaken to the Great Vehicle, and penetrate the supreme vehicle, dwell therein. They travel through the Three Realms’ heavens, teaching celestial beings and bodhisattvas, cultivating all Brahma-conducts.
*Collation:* An alternate text annotates: "The Emperor advances immortals to sagehood."

**Taiji Pingyu Jia Yi Heaven**—also called *Supreme Wondrous*—its color is dark green, corresponding to the north, aligning with the stellar mansion *Kui*. Here, celestial beings penetrate the wondrous Dao and realize the supreme mysterious awakening, and thus ascend to this heaven. Those who cultivate and progress to this point are called *Ultimate Ascension to the Mysterious*, transitioning into the Three Realms. **Emperor Great Selector of Dharma-Gates**—these four characters are the Heavenly King’s general script, inscribed in golden script and concealed within the Heaven’s *Tianbao* Palace.
*Collation:* An alternate text annotates: "The Emperor universally delivers the bodies of cultivators."

The thirty-two heavens, thirty-two emperors, and the hidden names and titles of all heavens.
