chunks.original_text: 明首主持正炁，开导诸天梵熙。 於是元始散游诸天，则法轮引籍，揽觉度魂，菩提转轮，昙颐扬幡。 自是九地开光，学人受度，此则元始以镇玉完天之云文。 稼那阿奕，忽诃流吟。 稼那，此天中掌籍真人。 阿奕，此天苑圃中琼林宝树之呼。 忽者，飞天神王名； 诃者，元始消息之称。 流者，流布； 吟者，吟咏。 当劫初时，元始於阿奕之下，嘘呵元梵之炁，自成灵音，流布万天，皆得吟咏。 然后稼那举藉，定是非死生，上奏玉京，即飞天神王下度世人也。 此则元始以镇何童天之云文。 华都曲丽，鲜菩育臻。 华即东极青华之都。 曲者，歌曲。 丽者，玉女之名。 鲜者，庆云之象。 菩者，此天中宝楼名也。 育者，帝讳。 臻者，至也。 谓元始时於华都命仙圣领诸玉妃登菩楼，歌洞章，则鲜云集其上，於是玉帝乃臻，开度九夜。 此则元始平育天之云文。 答落大梵，散烟庆云。 答落，谓此天中宫阙巍巍，上有答落之庭。 大梵，元始宥令之称。 散烟庆云，乃北天梵炁之余者也。 谓元始开大赦於答落宫庭，收摄元炁，放释罪魂，咸得余炁复元，结成云烟而聚集。 此则元始以镇元明文举天之云文。 颂曰： 阿那登楼鸣法鼓，洞章三奏日月户。 元始游行转法轮，登命须延开玉府。 嗟呵之炁成玉音，流布万天得歌舞。 天君王妃登菩楼，烟云摇曳舒玄素。 答落官庭大宥开，无量众生皆受度。 飞洒玉都，明魔上门。 飞者，飞天神王。 洒者，迅速之状。 玉者，玉真。 都者，酆都。 明者，明晓。 魔者，魔王。 上者，上帝。 门者，门下也。 谓元始为诸飞天神王演说正道，自龙汉之劫，至于延康，一一洒然； 学人能明晓其音，则玉真开长夜之府，酆都度八难之魂，魔王保迎，上帝育神，门下天真，欣然保度。 此则元始以镇摩夷天之云文也。 无行上首，回跖流玄。 行，音茎。 跖，音只。 无者，虚无。 行者，运行。 上首，北帝下宫之名。 回者，回转。 跖者，履跖。 流者，流晨之华。 玄者，空也。 谓元始禀虚无上道，纲维八极，使梵炁流行，下环北帝宫，以弥罗诸天。 运推数极，财大劫交至，初则元始复以流晨光华，履导空虚而布化。 玄者，玄空。 此天有空峰山，乃生死所归。 学人道未备足，身应灭度，其魂升入此山。 俟功满德足，然后转入南丹炼度。 此则元始以镇越衡天之云文。 阿陁龙罗，四象吁员。 阿者，此天中之山名，九折连阿而上。 陁者，山上楼名。 龙者，亦山名，与阿陁相去九万里。 罗者，日月之呼。 四者，四极。 象者，象车。 吁者，南昌上帝隐讳。 员者，日中仙童 之名。 谓阿山陁楼，其炁与玉清相属，此天帝君常游其上，察人罪福。 日月之光照于上。 学人道备则四极真人乘象车而下度其身，引领而谒南丹吁帝，以求炼度。 日中仙童仍以九阳金精之华，灌濯其体。 此则元始以镇蒙翳天之云文也。 南方八天 叩齿三通，思朱雀，凤凰翻翻直前，后绛云三重，覆匝身形。 密咒曰： 三炁徘徊，灵凤来飞。 玉音八字，烂焕紫微。 吉日大庆，我道洞开。 朱丹哺饴，仰吸灵晖。 身生水火，绛被羽衣。 登空飞步，足践丹梯。 周旋八天，七祖相随。 咒毕，引炁三咽止。 南爓　爓音艳　洞浮，玉眸诜诜。 南者，南方丹天世界。 爓者，火焰。
chunks.translated_text:
Ming Shou presides over the upright qi, guiding and illuminating all heavens with Brahma’s radiance. Thereupon the Originator roams through the heavens, where the Dharma Wheel draws the ledgers, Lan Jue delivers souls, the Bodhi Wheel turns, and Tan Yi raises the banners. Thus the Nine Lands unfold their light, and disciples receive deliverance—this is the cloud script by which the Originator pacifies the Jade Perfected Heaven.

Jia Na A Yi, Hu He Liu Yin.
Jia Na is the celestial perfected who keeps the ledgers in this heaven.
A Yi is the name invoked for the jade groves and treasure trees in this heaven’s gardens.
Hu is the name of a flying heavenly divine king;
He is the title of the Originator’s breath-messages.
Liu means “to disseminate”;
Yin means “to chant.”
At the kalpa’s beginning, the Originator beneath A Yi exhaled the primordial Brahma qi, spontaneously forming numinous sounds that disseminated through the ten thousand heavens, all chanting in harmony. Then Jia Na raised the ledgers, determining life and death and right and wrong, and reported to the Jade Capital, whereupon the flying heavenly divine king descended to deliver the people of the world—this is the cloud script by which the Originator pacifies the He Tong Heaven.

Hua Du Qu Li, Xian Pu Yu Zhen.
Hua is the Eastern Marchmount’s Azure Flower Capital.
Qu means “melodies.”
Li is the name of a jade maiden.
Xian is the image of auspicious clouds.
Pu is the name of a treasure tower in this heaven.
Yu is the name of an emperor.
Zhen means “to arrive.”
When the Originator was in the Hua Capital, he commanded the immortals and sages to lead the jade consorts up the Pu Tower to sing the cavernous chapters, whereupon auspicious clouds gathered above. Thus the Jade Emperor arrived to open the deliverance of the Nine Nights—this is the cloud script by which the Originator pacifies the Yu Yu Heaven.

Da Luo Da Fan, San Yan Qing Yun.
Da Luo refers to the towering palaces of this heaven, whose uppermost courts are called the Da Luo Halls.
Da Fan is the title of the Originator’s great amnesty.
San Yan Qing Yun are the remnants of the Brahma qi from the Northern Heaven.
When the Originator proclaimed a great amnesty in the Da Luo Halls, gathering and refining the primordial qi, releasing imprisoned souls, all received the remnant qi to restore their origin, coalescing into clouds and mist—this is the cloud script by which the Originator pacifies the Yuan Ming Wen Ju Heaven.

The ode says:
A Na ascends the tower to sound the Dharma drum,
The cavernous chapters thrice resound at the gates of sun and moon.
The Originator roams, turning the Dharma Wheel,
Commanding Xu Yan to open the Jade Perfected’s palace.
The sighing breath becomes jade tones,
Disseminating through the ten thousand heavens to song and dance.
Heavenly lords and jade consorts ascend the Pu Tower,
Mists and clouds sway, unfolding the mysterious and pure.
The Da Luo Halls proclaim the great amnesty,
Countless beings all receive deliverance.

Fei Sa Yu Du, Ming Mo Shang Men.
Fei are the flying heavenly divine kings.
Sa describes swiftness.
Yu refers to the Jade Perfected.
Du is Feng Du.
Ming means “to understand clearly.”
Mo are the demon kings.
Shang means “the Supreme Emperor.”
Men refers to the gate’s attendants.
When the Originator expounded the upright Dao to the flying heavenly divine kings, from the Long Han kalpa to the Yan Kang kalpa, all swiftly responded. Disciples who clearly understood the sounds opened the Jade Perfected’s palace of eternal night, delivered the souls of the Eight Difficulties from Feng Du, where demon kings safeguarded their passage, the Supreme Emperor nurtured their spirits, and the gate’s celestial perfected joyfully ensured their deliverance—this is the cloud script by which the Originator pacifies the Mo Yi Heaven.

Wu Xing Shang Shou, Hui Zhi Liu Xuan.
Xing is pronounced *jing*.
Zhi is pronounced *zhi*.
Wu means “emptiness.”
Xing means “to circulate.”
Shang Shou is the name of the Northern Emperor’s lower palace.
Hui means “to revolve.”
Zhi means “to tread.”
Liu means “flowing morning blossoms.”
Xuan means “void.”
The Originator, upholding the supreme Dao of emptiness, governs the eight directions, causing the Brahma qi to circulate and encircle the Northern Emperor’s palace, pervading all heavens. When the kalpa’s reckoning reaches its end, the Originator once more treads the void with flowing morning light to spread transformation. Xuan refers to the Void Peak Mountain, the destination of life and death. Disciples whose Dao is incomplete and whose bodies face dissolution ascend this mountain in spirit. Once their merit is complete and their virtue fulfilled, they proceed to the Southern Cinnabar for refinement and deliverance—this is the cloud script by which the Originator pacifies the Yue Heng Heaven.

A Tuo Long Luo, Si Xiang Xu Yuan.
A is the name of a mountain in this heaven, winding upward in nine folds.
Tuo is the name of a tower on the mountain.
Long is another mountain, nine myriad leagues from A Tuo.
Luo is the name invoked for the sun and moon.
Si are the Four Poles.
Xiang are the elephant chariots.
Xu is the hidden name of the Southern Prosperity Emperor.
Yuan is the name of the sun’s immortal youths.
The qi of A Mountain and Tuo Tower connects with the Jade Clarity. The lord of this heaven often roams there to observe the sins and blessings of people. The light of the sun and moon shines upon it. When disciples’ Dao is complete, the perfected of the Four Poles descend in elephant chariots to deliver their bodies, leading them to pay homage to the Xu Emperor of the Southern Cinnabar for refinement. The sun’s immortal youths then bathe their forms with the blossoms of ninefold yang golden essence—this is the cloud script by which the Originator pacifies the Meng Yi Heaven.

The Eight Southern Heavens:
Knock the teeth thrice, visualize the Vermilion Bird, phoenixes soaring straight ahead, followed by three layers of crimson clouds enveloping the body. The secret incantation says:
Three qi meander, the numinous phoenix comes flying.
Eight jade tones, resplendent in the Purple Tenuity.
Auspicious day, great celebration, my Dao unfolds.
Vermilion cinnabar nourishes, I gaze upward to absorb the numinous radiance.
Body born of water and fire, clad in crimson feathered robes.
Ascend the void, tread the flying steps, feet upon the cinnabar ladder.
Circumambulate the eight heavens, seven ancestors follow.
After the incantation, draw the qi and swallow thrice to conclude.

Nan Yan—*Yan* pronounced *yan*—Dong Fu, Yu Mou Shen Shen.
Nan is the Southern Cinnabar Heaven.
Yan means “flames.”
Dong means “to pervade.”
Fu means “to float.”
Yu Mou are jade eyes.
Shen Shen describes their brightness.
chunks.overlap_context:
singing the cavernous chapters to open the deliverance of humans and heavens. This is the cloud script by which the Originator pacifies the Yellow Layered Heaven.

Xu Yan, Ming Shou,
Fa Lan, Pu Tan.
Xu Yan are the taboo names of the celestial perfected.
Ming Shou is the name of a former sage.
Fa, Lan, Pu, and Tan are the four perfected of the Jade Clarity’s four palaces.
When the great kalpa turns, the Originator commands Xu Yan to open the Jade Perfected’s palace to receive the many immortals.

chunks.original_text: 洞者，洞阳宫也。 浮者，浮沉。 玉眸者，火之膏质。 诜诜者，盛也。 谓南方丹天有洞阳宫流火之庭，火焰飞浮，洞焕八方，玉眸之质，光明交映，诜诜然何其多也，乃真人炼形之所。 此则元始以镇和阳天之云文也。 梵形落空，九灵推前。 梵形，谓元始。 从劫至劫，历代化生，皆以大梵之炁，凝而成形，以一神而现，不受胎生，从空而生，故云落空。 九灵者，玉都九华真人。 推前者，此天中台名真人，常奉天帝散花其上，啸咏洞章，开度天人也。 此则元始以镇恭华天之云文。 凙音托洛音鹤菩台，绿罗大千。 凙者，天中山名。 洛者，神真道君讳。 菩者，飞天真人内音。 台者，玉台在凙山之阳。 绿罗者，月宫夫人内音。 大千者，世界劫数之称。 凡百至千日一千，自一千至再千日小千，自小千至再千日大千。 谓凙山众龙所伏，中有黄房之宫，洛君居其中，自劫至劫，不灭不生，时领诸菩登玉台，歌洞章以度人。 绿罗，字罗英，其形如玉，美莹无艳，乘大梵炁，理治太阴，度数以应天元，无有差忒。 至大劫交，则日月俱会於玉台，俟劫运再开，复运化也。 此则元始以镇宗飘天之云文。
chunks.translated_text:
The *Dong* refers to the Cavernous Yang Palace. *Fu* means "to float and sink." *Yu mou* are the fatty essence of fire. *Shen shen* means "flourishing." It is said that in the Southern Cinnabar Heaven, there is a Flowing Fire Courtyard within the Cavernous Yang Palace, where flames soar and drift, illuminating the eight directions in radiant splendor. The essence of jade eyes shines in mutual reflection, so flourishing—how abundant it is!—that it becomes the place where perfected beings refine their forms. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Beginning stabilizes the Harmonious Yang Heaven.

The *Fan xing* descends from the void—*Fan xing* refers to the Primordial Beginning. From kalpa to kalpa, through successive transformations, it coalesces into form from the great Brahma-qi, manifesting as a single spirit without undergoing womb-birth, emerging from the void, hence "descends from the void." The *Nine Spirits* are the Nine Radiant Perfected of the Jade Capital. *Tui qian* means that in this heaven, the name of the Central Terrace is the Perfected, who constantly attend the Heavenly Thearch, scattering flowers above, chanting cavernous hymns, and delivering celestial and human beings. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Beginning stabilizes the Reverent Radiance Heaven.

*Duo*—pronounced *tuo*—*Luo*—pronounced *he*—*Pu* Terrace, Green Gauze, Great Thousand. *Duo* is the name of a mountain in heaven. *Luo* is the taboo name of the Divine Perfected Dao Lord. *Pu* is the inner sound of the Flying Heavenly Perfected. *Terrace* refers to the Jade Terrace on the southern side of Mount Duo. *Green Gauze* is the inner sound of the Lady of the Lunar Palace. *Great Thousand* is a term for the kalpas of the world. From one to a hundred is a thousand; from one thousand to two thousand is the Lesser Thousand; from the Lesser Thousand to another thousand is the Great Thousand.

It is said that Mount Duo is where the myriad dragons submit. Within it lies the Yellow Chamber Palace, where Lord Luo resides, enduring from kalpa to kalpa without destruction or birth. At times, he leads the various *Pu* to ascend the Jade Terrace, singing cavernous hymns to deliver beings. Green Gauze—her name is Luo Ying—her form is like jade, beautiful and lustrous without ostentation. Riding the great Brahma-qi, she governs the Great Yin, her calculations aligning with the celestial origins without error. When the great kalpa turns, the sun and moon both converge at the Jade Terrace, awaiting the reopening of the kalpic destiny to resume their transformations. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Beginning stabilizes the Ancestral Drifting Heaven.

chunks.original_text: 颂曰： 浩劫由来元始王，龙汉说法至延康。 开明无上真道炁，连环运转维八荒。 学人道备功德满，拜谒吁帝登南昌。 玉眸黄华光四映，火炼魂神应九阳。 始乎元始下生界，梵炁结形空裹翔。 凙山真人得至道，不生不灭居黄房。 经纬天地日与月，亘大千兮莫可量。 眇莽九丑，韶谣缘邅。 眇莽者，混沌之状。 九丑者，大力鬼兽。 韶者，魔王内音。 谣者，瑶歌。 缘者，南斗之别名。 邅者，北斗之别号。 谓天地未分，其状眇眇莽莽，九兽之鬼，齐天而生，应天度九九八十一万数，数极而劫交。 此鬼号为九都使者。 元始使辅三官，同考生死。 韶者，神霄宫魔王，谣歌恼试学人。 若心坚固，保举之司，诣南北二司系仙籍，除死名。 次入此天之金华山，谒太乙帝君，求合同符契，乃得游宴诸天。 此则元始以镇皇笳天之云文。 云上九都，飞生自骞。 云上者，飞天神王内讳。 九都者，九玄之都，玄台之别名也。 飞生者，更生大神之名。 自者，从也。 骞者，骞林也。 谓云上散百和名香，流五云之华，执太真玉印、十绝灵旛，一日三回，回旛一周，则诸天上帝齐到坛下，绕坛三匝，诵咏洞章，然后开度。 若人识此歌音，则更生大神为开不死之路，流长生之炁； 炼其五魂，五魂既炼，则八景存焉。 从而保举入玄台、游骞林矣。 三十四年毕，元始命下，乃得南丹炼度。 此则元始以镇堂耀天之云文。 那育郁馥，摩罗法轮。 那者，此天天王侍郎之内名。 育者，天阙空轮。 郁馥者，斗中灵童内号。 摩罗者，天中魔王。 法轮者，大法之轮也。 谓那主四时之无，运大法轮，正天分度，罔有差忒。 数极则劫交，然后魔王歌洞章之曲，而度应受度人。 天轮十转足，则诸天上帝三界万神俱至，郁馥唱礼。 一唱万神齐礼，魔王束形。 此则元始以镇端靖天之云文。 霐持无镜，揽姿运容。 霐者，龙渊之神，都监之内号。 持者，龙渊之名也。 无镜者，飞天神王名也。 揽姿者，三界天门之名。 运容者，玄和玉女异号。 谓九龙伏于持渊，常含金罂而运东井黄华之水以灌濯於天人。 学人成道，无镜为开长夜之府，升度其九祖，同过三界天门。 然后运容玉女以朱陵之炁引导其魂，玄和之津灌注其体。 此则元始以镇恭庆天之云文。 馥朗廓奕，神缨自宫。 馥朗者，天中玄台山名。 廓奕者，天中神公之内号。 神缨者，紫微灵童名也。 宫者，紫微宫。 谓廓奕神公与元始同生，为玄炁之祖，常与此天帝歌洞章於馥朗之上。 然后真人为开度学人，神缨导引，自紫微宫而朝元始。 此则元始以镇极瑶天之云文。 颂曰： 学人欲谒金华真，谣歌不试胡为成。 况复飞生流道炁，炼濯五魂澄百神。 那兮运轮魔敢犯，朗馥一唱束万形。 无镜时开长夜府，九祖俱沐玄和津。 廓奕犹歌洞章曲，直造紫微朝玉宸。 西方八天 叩齿七通，思白虎狮子导引左右，素云七重，覆匝身形。 密咒曰： 七炁金灵，八天尊神。 白虎策辇，狮子捧辕。 七炁缠绵，炼我成仙。 身发金光，映照素灵。 内外变化，升入洞门。 七祖出夜，九幽放魂。 亿劫开度，随运长存。 咒毕，引炁七咽止。 刀利禅猷，婆泥咎　咎音高　通。 刀利者，南方世界之号。 禅者，国名，禅黎也。 猷者，好生君内名。 婆泥者，洞阳宫灵童名也。
chunks.translated_text:
Hymn states:
From the vast kalpas comes the Primordial King,
In Dragon Han he preached the Dharma until Yan Kang.
Revealing the peerless true Dao-qi,
Its linked cycles govern the Eight Wastes.

When disciples perfect the Way and fulfill their virtue,
They petition the August Emperor to ascend Nanchang.
Jade pupils and yellow blossoms radiate light in four directions,
Fire-refined souls and spirits respond to the Nine Suns.

At first the Primordial descended to the mortal realm,
Brahma-qi congealed his form, soaring through the void.
The Perfected of Mount Duo attained the supreme Way,
Abiding in the Yellow Chamber, neither born nor destroyed.

He weaves the warp and weft of heaven and earth, sun and moon,
Spanning the Great Thousand—boundless and immeasurable.
Vast and formless, the Nine Uglies,
Sháo melodies and yáo songs, Yuán and Zhān.

Vast and formless describes the state of primordial chaos.
The Nine Uglies are mighty demonic beasts.
Sháo is the inner sound of the demon kings.
Yáo refers to jade hymns.
Yuán is another name for the Southern Dipper.
Zhān is another name for the Northern Dipper.

When heaven and earth were yet undivided,
Their form was dim and boundless.
The nine demonic beasts, born equal to heaven,
Accorded with the celestial reckoning of nine nines—eighty-one myriad.
When the numbers reached their limit, the kalpa turned.
These demons are called the Nine Capital Envoys.
The Primordial commanded the Three Officials to assist,
Jointly examining life and death.

Sháo is the demon king of the Divine Empyrean Palace,
Whose yáo songs disturb and test disciples.
If the heart remains steadfast,
The Bureau of Recommendations records them in the immortal registers of the Southern and Northern Offices,
Erasing their names from death.

Next, they enter the Golden Flower Mountain of this heaven,
To pay homage to the Supreme Unity Emperor,
Seeking the matching talismanic contract,
Thereby gaining admittance to roam and feast among the heavens.
This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial stabilizes the Imperial Reed Heaven.

Above the clouds are the Nine Capitals,
Where flying life is self-renewing.
"Above the clouds" is the inner name of the flying celestial kings.
The Nine Capitals are another name for the Nine Mysteries’ capital, the Mystic Terrace.
"Flying life" is the name of the Great God of Rebirth.
"Self" means "from."
"Renewing" refers to the Qian Forest.

It is said that above the clouds, a hundred harmonious incenses scatter,
Flowing with the blossoms of the five clouds.
Holding the Jade Seal of the Supreme Perfected and the Ten Absolute Spirit Banners,
Thrice daily they circumambulate.
With each circuit of the banners,
All the Heavenly Emperors of the various heavens gather beneath the altar,
Encircling it thrice,
Chanting the cavernous hymns,
Then initiating the deliverance.

If one recognizes this song,
The Great God of Rebirth opens the path of deathlessness,
Flowing the qi of eternal life.
Refining the five souls,
Once the five souls are refined,
The Eight Sceneries abide within.
Thereafter, they are recommended to enter the Mystic Terrace
And wander the Qian Forest.
After thirty-four years are complete,
The Primordial issues his command,
And they proceed to the Southern Cinnabar for refinement and deliverance.
This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial stabilizes the Hall Radiance Heaven.

Nà nurtures lush fragrance,
Móluó turns the Dharma Wheel.
Nà is the inner name of the attendant of this heaven’s Heavenly King.
Yù is the empty wheel of the celestial gate.
Yùfù is the inner name of the spirit youth within the Dipper.
Móluó is the demon king of heaven.
The Dharma Wheel is the wheel of the great Dharma.

It is said that Nà governs the four seasons’ void,
Turning the great Dharma Wheel,
Rectifying the divisions of heaven,
Without error.
When the numbers reach their limit and the kalpa turns,
The demon king then sings the cavernous hymns
To deliver those who are to be delivered.
When the celestial wheel completes ten revolutions,
All the Heavenly Emperors of the various heavens and the myriad spirits of the Three Realms arrive,
Yùfù intones the rites.
At one intonation, the myriad spirits bow in unison,
And the demon king restrains his form.
This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial stabilizes the Upright Tranquility Heaven.

Hóng holds the mirrorless,
Lǎnzī guides the bearing and movement.
Hóng is the inner name of the dragon abyss’s spirit, the capital overseer.
Chí is the name of the dragon abyss.
The mirrorless is the name of the flying celestial king.
Lǎnzī is the name of the Three Realms’ celestial gate.
Yùnróng is another name for the Jade Maiden of Mystic Harmony.

It is said that the nine dragons submit to Chí Abyss,
Constantly containing golden vases to channel the yellow blossom waters of the Eastern Well,
Irrigating the celestial beings.
When disciples attain the Way,
The mirrorless opens the long-night’s repository,
Delivering their nine ancestors,
Together passing through the Three Realms’ celestial gate.
Then the Yùnróng Jade Maiden,
With the qi of the Vermilion Mound,
Guides their souls,
While the dew of Mystic Harmony irrigates their bodies.
This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial stabilizes the Reverent Celebration Heaven.

Fùlǎng is vast and radiant,
Shényīng dwells in the celestial palace.
Fùlǎng is the name of the Mystic Terrace Mountain in heaven.
Kuòyì is the inner name of the celestial divine duke.
Shényīng is the name of the Purple Tenuity spirit youth.
The palace is the Purple Tenuity Palace.

It is said that the Kuòyì divine duke was born with the Primordial,
As the ancestor of the Mystic Qi,
Constantly singing cavernous hymns with this heaven’s emperor atop Fùlǎng.
Then the Perfected open the path for disciples,
Shényīng guides them,
From the Purple Tenuity Palace to pay homage to the Primordial.
This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial stabilizes the Ultimate Jade Heaven.

Hymn states:
Disciples wishing to pay homage to the Golden Flower Perfected,
How can they succeed without enduring the yáo songs’ trials?
Moreover, the flying life flows the Dao-qi,
Refining and bathing the five souls, clarifying the hundred spirits.
Nà turns the wheel—how dare the demons offend?
At Fùlǎng’s single intonation, the myriad forms are restrained.
The mirrorless opens the long-night’s repository in due time,
Nine ancestors together bathe in the dew of Mystic Harmony.
Kuòyì still sings the cavernous hymns,
Proceeding directly to the Purple Tenuity to pay homage at the Jade Throne.

The Eight Heavens of the West:
Knock the teeth seven times, visualize the White Tiger and Lion guiding left and right,
Seven layers of plain clouds enveloping the body.

Secret incantation:
Seven qi of golden numinosity,
Honored spirits of the Eight Heavens.
The White Tiger spurs the chariot,
The Lion supports the shafts.
Seven qi entwine,
Refining me into an immortal.
The body emits golden light,
Illuminating the plain spirits.
Inner and outer transformations,
Ascending into the cavernous gate.
Seven ancestors emerge from the night,
Nine darknesses release their souls.
Deliverance through kalpas infinite,
Abiding with the turning of destiny.

After the incantation, guide the qi and swallow seven times, then cease.

Dāolì Chányóu, Póní Gāo (Gāo pronounced as in "high") Tōng.
Dāolì is the name of the southern world.
Chán is the name of the country, Chánlí.
Yóu is the inner name of the Lord of Good Life.
Póní is the name of the spirit youth of the Cavernous Yang Palace.

chunks.original_text: 咎通者，天中魔王内讳。 谓刀利世界禅黎国土有洞阳之宫，元始於此火炼真文，真文既经火炼，光明莹彻，洞焕万天。 然后此世界为大福堂，一切罪魂咸令升入，若人成道，猷君监真，婆泥炼魂而度命，咎通常遏绝生门。 若明此音，则众魔奉焉。 此则元始以镇孔升天之云文。 宛薮涤色，太眇之堂。 宛薮，天帝内号。 涤者，涤荡也。 色者，色界也。 太眇之堂者，乃天中大福堂也。 谓皇崖天帝主开太漠之经，理治天炁，每领诸真游行色界，诸天出入上清之府，荡涤秽气，保持此界之天，开度善信之人。 若诸天人行业高者，则天帝升之，得乘景云之车，上生太眇之堂，乃天之秘府，中隐大洞自然之章。 此则元始以镇皇崖天之云文。 流罗梵萌，景蔚萧嵎。 流者，天王名也。 罗者，月女之讳。 梵者，飞天真人名也。 萌者，元始天王之名。 景者，景皇，乃四极上真。 蔚者，蔚秀，乃景霄仙人。 萧嵎者，劫仞之宫。 谓流君时游九霄，月皇游宴之仪，飞天真人开九天之关，萌君正梵炁，开度天人，保固极风之根。 又萧嵎者，乃西方白素元君之宫，景皇蔚秀，开治其中，学人明识其音，乃可以驭丹龙之辔，升九色之霄，陟九皇之台。 此则元始以镇极风天之云文。 易邈无寂，宛首少都。 易邈者，始皇天帝内名。 无者，虚无。 寂者，庭名也。 宛首者，太上道君内讳。 少都者，日中仙童名也。 谓始皇天君自龙汉而来，至于赤明，居虚无之内，处寂寂之庭，奉道君开元始之奥，演大法以度人。 灵童少都，仍散日华之精，以灌真流，飞霞之辉以拂尘。 此则元始以镇孝芒天之云文。 阿褴 褴即滥 郁竺，华漠延由。 阿褴者，天帝隐讳。 郁者，魔王郁默之称。 竺者，谓欲界也。 华者，谓色界也。 漠者，溟漠也。 延乃束鬼之庭，由乃禁鬼之房。 谓郁魔之众，恼乱天人，或居色界，或居欲界，隐现於光华之内，眇漠而不可寻究。 帝君阿褴，登九层之楼，歌洞章以摄之。 於是众魔应响而束身，韦鬼诣由而伏形，保爱天人也。 此则元始以镇浮容天之云文。 九开自辩，阿那品首。 九开，天地大衍之数。 自者，自然。 辩者，明辩。 阿者，天帝内名阿丘也。 那者，那邪飞天神人隐名。 品者，品量。 首者，众首。 谓大衍之数，天地未判，三炁混沌，开为九分九度。 九度既开，然后阴阳男女别，自然明辩也。 又帝君阿丘常登龙山，游九玄之都。 赦诸那邪游空，开度善根之人，品度其魂，升入飞仙之上首。 此则元始以镇江由天之云文。 颂曰： 真文火炼光莹彻，无量罪魂升福国。 皇崖帝君游诸天，升出天人齐行业。 流罗梵萌持九霄，极风之根无散灭。 赤明教主日道君，开玄演法以度人。 郁魔隐现不可寻，一闻洞章皆伏形。 戒尔众生修善行，升入飞仙第一伦。 无量扶盖，浮罗合神。 无量者，此天大圣尊神。 扶者，更生 君内名。 盖者，此天有盖官。 浮者幽魂之呼。 罗者，大罗。 合者，合庆。 神者，神公。 谓无量尊神总统飞天神人，皆受品量而升进之。 更生君主长夜之录，定善恶之根，开大千世界，度诸幽魂，升於大罗诸宫，与神公而合庆。 此则元始以镇阮乐天之云文。 玉诞长桑，栢空度仙。 玉诞者，天中玉都之别名。 长桑者，扶桑之林。
chunks.translated_text:
Jue Tong is the inner taboo name of the Demon King of Heaven. It is said that within the lands of Chanli in the Daoli world lies the Cavernous Yang Palace, where the Primordial Origin refined the True Writs in fire. Once the True Writs underwent fire refinement, their radiance became pure and luminous, illuminating the myriad heavens. Thereafter, this world became the Great Hall of Blessings, where all sinful souls are enabled to ascend. Should one attain the Dao, Lord You monitors their authenticity, Poni refines their soul to deliver their life, and Jue Tong seals off the gate of rebirth. If one comprehends this sound, all demons will submit. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Opening Caverns.

Wansou Dises, Tai Miao’s Hall.
Wansou is the inner name of the Heavenly Emperor. Di means "to cleanse." Se refers to the realm of form. Tai Miao’s Hall is the Great Hall of Blessings in Heaven. It is said that the Heavenly Emperor of Huangya presides over the opening of the Great Desert’s scriptures, governing the qi of Heaven. He often leads the perfected ones to traverse the realm of form, where the heavens enter and exit the Upper Clarity’s palace, purging impure qi to safeguard this celestial realm and deliver the faithful. Should the karmic deeds of heavenly beings be lofty, the Heavenly Emperor elevates them to ride the cloud chariots of radiant light, ascending to Tai Miao’s Hall—the celestial secret treasury wherein the great cavern’s natural chapters are concealed. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Huangya.

Liuluo Fanmeng, Jingwei Xiaoyu.
Liu is the name of a Heavenly King. Luo is the taboo name of the Moon Maiden. Fan is the name of a Flying Heavenly Perfected One. Meng is the name of the Primordial Origin Heavenly King. Jing is Jing Huang, a supreme perfected one of the Four Poles. Wei is Weixiu, an immortal of Jingxiao. Xiaoyu is the palace of Eon’s Height. It is said that Lord Liu roams the Nine Heavens, the Moon Sovereign attends the banquet of rites, the Flying Heavenly Perfected One opens the gates of the Nine Heavens, and Lord Meng rectifies the qi of the Dao to deliver heavenly beings and secure the root of the Ultimate Wind. Moreover, Xiaoyu is the palace of the White Primordial Sovereign of the West, where Jing Huang and Weixiu govern. Should practitioners clearly recognize these sounds, they may then harness the reins of cinnabar dragons, ascend the Nine-Colored Heavens, and scale the terraces of the Nine Emperors. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Ultimate Wind.

Yi Miao Wuji, Wanshou Shaodu.
Yi Miao is the inner name of the Celestial Emperor of the Beginning. Wu means "emptiness." Ji is the name of a courtyard. Wanshou is the inner taboo of the Supreme Dao Lord. Shaodu is the name of the immortal youth within the sun. It is said that the Celestial Lord of the Beginning has come from the Dragon Han era to the Red Clarity, dwelling within the void and residing in the tranquil courtyard. He serves the Dao Lord in unfolding the mysteries of the Primordial Origin and expounding the great Dharma to deliver humanity. The immortal youth Shaodu scatters the essence of solar radiance to irrigate the true currents, and the brilliance of flying auroras to brush away dust. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Filial Purity.

Alan (Lan as in "flood") Yuzhu, Huamo Yanyou.
Alan is the hidden taboo of the Heavenly Emperor. Yu is the title of the Demon King Yumo. Zhu refers to the realm of desire. Hua refers to the realm of form. Mo means "boundless." Yan is the court that binds ghosts. You is the chamber that imprisons ghosts. It is said that the hordes of Yu’s demons disturb heavenly beings, dwelling either in the realm of form or the realm of desire, appearing and vanishing within radiant light, elusive and unfathomable in the boundless. The Heavenly Emperor Alan ascends the nine-tiered tower and chants the cavernous chapters to subdue them. Thereupon, the demonic multitudes respond to the resonance, binding themselves, while ghostly minions prostrate in the You chamber, preserving the love of heavenly beings. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Floating Capacities.

Jiu Kai Zibian, Anapinshou.
Jiu Kai is the great reckoning number of Heaven and Earth. Zi means "naturally." Bian means "to discern clearly." A is the inner name of the Heavenly Emperor Aqiu. Na is the hidden name of the flying heavenly being Naxie. Pin means "to assess." Shou means "the foremost." It is said that the great reckoning number, before the separation of Heaven and Earth, when the three qi were in chaos, unfolded into nine divisions and nine measures. Once the nine measures were opened, yin and yang, male and female became distinct, naturally discerned. Moreover, the Heavenly Emperor Aqiu often ascends Dragon Mountain and roams the capital of the Nine Mysteries. He absolves the Naxie who wander the void, delivering those of good roots, assessing their souls, and elevating them to the foremost ranks of flying immortals. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Jiangyou.

The Ode states:
True Writs refined in fire, radiance pure and bright,
Countless sinful souls ascend to the land of blessings.
The Emperor of Huangya traverses the heavens,
Elevating heavenly beings according to their deeds.
Liuluo Fanmeng uphold the Nine Heavens,
The root of Ultimate Wind remains undispersed.
The Lord of Red Clarity, the Solar Dao Lord,
Unfolds the mysteries and expounds the Dharma to deliver humanity.
Yu’s demons appear and vanish, elusive,
Yet at the sound of cavernous chapters, all prostrate.
Admonish all beings to cultivate good deeds,
Ascend to the foremost rank of flying immortals.

Boundless Canopies, Floating Nets Conjoin Spirits.
Boundless is the great sage deity of this heaven. Fu is the inner name of the Lord of Renewal. Gai refers to the canopy officials of this heaven. Fu is the cry of wandering souls. Luo is the Great Net. He means "to unite in celebration." Shen refers to the Divine Duke. It is said that the Boundless Venerable Deity governs the flying heavenly perfected ones, all of whom are assessed and elevated. The Lord of Renewal presides over the records of the Long Night, determining the roots of good and evil, opening the great thousandfold world to deliver wandering souls, elevating them to the palaces of the Great Net, and uniting in celebration with the Divine Duke. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Joyous Harmony.

Jade Birth, Ever-Mulberry, Cypress Void, Delivering Immortals.
Jade Birth is another name for the Jade Capital of Heaven. Ever-Mulberry refers to the grove of Fusang.

After the incantation, guide the qi and swallow seven times, then cease.

Dāolì Chányóu, Póní Gāo (Gāo pronounced as in "high") Tōng.
Dāolì is the name of the southern world.
Chán is the name of the country, Chánlí.
Yóu is the inner name of the Lord of Good Life.
Póní is the name of the spirit youth of the Cavernous Yang Palace.

chunks.original_text: 栢空者，洞章之音。 度仙者，度人成仙。 谓玉诞有骞木扶桑之林，荫覆诸天，其叶上皆紫字玉书，大洞之文。 每神风吹返魂之草，桑林鼓百籁之音，自成空歌之曲，故曰栢空。 灵鸡栖於其上，一鸣则天下群鸡皆应声而鸣，於是青霞扶摇，太阳乃升，故诸飞天神人以鸡鸣之初，登玉台，探五方云牙，吸咽三晨之光，同度学仙之人。 此则元始以镇昙誓天之云文。 北方八天 叩齿五通，思飞龙羽盖。 苍郁左右，黑云五重，覆匝身形，神童玉女，羽衣飞裳，侍卫身形。 密咒曰： 玄天徘徊，流景上清。 大有启运，八字开明。 飞玄澄空，洞阴自生。 五炁缠绵，灌我身形。 冠带北单，受炼洞灵。 肾府仙化，内外光精。 飞行三界，游宴紫庭。 七祖同庆，欢乐劫龄。 七宝林中，反胎更生。 长夜出离，南宫记名。 黄箓白简，世世生仙。 咒毕，引炁五咽止。 玃无自育，九日导乾。 玃无者，飞天神王内名。 自者，从也。 育者，即天帝内名。 九者，九玄之都。 日者，日童也。 导即引导也。 乾者，天常也。 谓玃无从龙汉溟涬之间，乘运而出，时与育帝乘凤车、游九玄之都，转九机之度，以应劫运之数。 日华童子仍开导和炁，俟劫交则日停光而运化。 此则元始以镇霄度天之云文。 坤母东覆，形摄上玄。 坤母者，太阴都候九灵仙母。 东者，东海。 覆者，理水大神。 形者，地机之形。 摄者，召也。 上者，上言。 玄者，玄都。 谓九灵坤母治东极扶桑旸谷之渊，总持地机，旋转元炁，以天关地机，转动一周，则水涌溢三千三百度。 度极则天地炁交，九海混一，众水弥天，覆神治昆仑之顶，主填涸巨海，遏断东井之源，使地机不沦。 如劫数终，则坤母出东井，召鸟母於龙门，制会河源，上诣帝前，申告劫会，仍以大凤之车，升载学人，升于昆仑，以朝玄都。 此则元始以镇元洞天之云文。 陀罗育邈，眇炁合云。 陁者，飞天神王之名。 罗者，月光之称。 育者，妙成天主之讳。 邈者，羽林监神名。 眇者，眇眇高远也。 炁者，云炁。 合者，合景。 谓陁与育俱生於云阿之岭，抱月之光，总持羽林军，时敕邈神游行三界，保度得道之人，令诣羽林受符信。 羽林在北自与诸天合景，眇眇然行於云宫结云炁以为衣。 此则元始以镇妙成天之 云文。 颂曰：
chunks.translated_text:
Cypress Void is the sound of the Cavernous Chapters. Delivering Immortals means delivering people to achieve immortality. It is said that Jade Birth contains the soaring Fusang grove, which shades and covers all heavens, its leaves inscribed above with purple-script jade texts—the writings of the Great Cavern. Whenever the divine wind stirs the soul-returning grasses, the Fusang grove resounds with the music of a hundred pipes, naturally forming the melody of the Void Song—hence called Cypress Void. The numinous rooster perches upon it; when it crows, all roosters under heaven respond in unison. Then azure mist swirls upward, and the sun ascends. Thus, at the first cock’s crow, the flying heavenly perfected ones ascend the Jade Terrace, gather the five-directional cloud-teeth, and inhale the light of the Three Mornings, together delivering those who study immortality. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Vow and Oath.

The Eight Heavens of the North:
Knock the teeth five times, envision the flying dragon’s feathered canopy.
Dark verdure on left and right, five layers of black clouds envelop the body.
Divine youths and jade maidens, clad in feathered robes and flying garments, guard the form.
The secret incantation says:
"Dark heavens meander, streaming light ascends to the Upper Clarity.
Great Possession initiates movement, eight characters reveal brightness.
Flying mystery clarifies the void, the cavernous yin generates itself.
Five qi entwine, irrigating my form.
Crowned and girded in the Northern Lone, receiving refinement from the Cavernous Spirit.
The kidney palace transforms into immortality, inner and outer radiance.
Flying through the Three Realms, roaming and feasting in the Purple Court.
Seven ancestors rejoice together, delighting in kalpas of age.
Within the Seven Treasures Grove, rebirth reverses the womb.
Emerging from the Long Night, names recorded in the Southern Palace.
Yellow Registers and White Slips—generation after generation, born as immortals."
After the incantation, guide the qi and swallow five times to conclude.

Juewu Self-Nurtures, Nine Days Guide Qian.
Juewu is the inner name of the flying heavenly divine king. *Self* means "to follow." *Nurtures* is the inner name of the Heavenly Emperor. *Nine* refers to the capital of the Nine Mysteries. *Days* are the sun youths. *Guide* means to lead. *Qian* is the constancy of heaven. It is said that Juewu emerges from the Dragon Han’s primordial chaos, borne by the turning of fate, and at times accompanies the Nurturing Emperor in a phoenix chariot, touring the capital of the Nine Mysteries, revolving the nine mechanisms of destiny to align with the kalpa’s reckoning. The sun-splendor youths then open and guide harmonious qi, awaiting the kalpa’s transition—when the sun halts its light to enact transformation. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Ascending Radiance.

The Earth Mother Covers the East, Her Form Grasps the Upper Mystery.
The Earth Mother is the Nine-Spirit Immortal Mother, overseer of the Great Yin capital. *East* is the Eastern Sea. *Covers* is the great water-governing spirit. *Form* is the earth’s mechanism. *Grasps* means to summon. *Upper* means above. *Mystery* is the Mystery Capital. It is said that the Nine-Spirit Earth Mother governs the Eastern Limit’s Fusang Yang Valley abyss, mastering the earth’s mechanism, revolving primordial qi. When the celestial gate and earth’s mechanism turn once, waters surge three thousand three hundred degrees. At the limit of degrees, heaven and earth’s qi intermingle, the nine seas merge into one, and myriad waters fill the sky. The Covering Spirit governs the summit of Kunlun, filling the vast seas and damming the source of the Eastern Well, preventing the earth’s mechanism from sinking. When the kalpa’s end arrives, the Earth Mother emerges from the Eastern Well, summons the Bird Mother at Dragon Gate, convenes the river’s source, and ascends to the Emperor’s presence to report the kalpa’s reckoning. Then, with a great phoenix chariot, she bears the students upward to Kunlun to pay homage at the Mystery Capital. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Primordial Cavern.

Tuoluo Nurtures the Remote, Subtle Qi Merges with Clouds.
*Tuo* is the name of a flying heavenly divine king. *Luo* is the designation of moonlight. *Nurtures* is the taboo name of the Wondrous Completion Heaven’s lord. *Remote* is the name of the Feathered Forest supervisory spirit. *Subtle* means lofty and distant. *Qi* is cloud qi. *Merges* means to merge with the radiance. It is said that Tuo and Nurtures both arise from the Cloud Ridge, embracing the moon’s light, commanding the Feathered Forest army. They often dispatch the Remote Spirit to traverse the Three Realms, protecting and delivering those who attain the Dao, guiding them to the Feathered Forest to receive talismanic credentials. The Feathered Forest lies north, merging its radiance with all heavens, subtly traversing the cloud palaces, weaving cloud qi into garments. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Wondrous Completion.

er the records of the Long Night, determining the roots of good and evil, opening the great thousandfold world to deliver wandering souls, elevating them to the palaces of the Great Net, and uniting in celebration with the Divine Duke. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Joyous Harmony.

Jade Birth, Ever-Mulberry, Cypress Void, Delivering Immortals.
Jade Birth is another name for the Jade Capital of Heaven. Ever-Mulberry refers to the grove of Fusang.

chunks.original_text: 阮乐天君无量尊，开度长夜出幽昏。 神风飘飘吹返魂，柏之空歌皆洞言。 灵鸡初鸣扶桑端，真人探集云芽餐。 玃无乘运应乾元，旋转九运保天根。 劫终鸟母会龙门，学人乘凤升昆仑。 羽林受符拜新恩，云衣缥缈朝帝轩。 飞天大丑，总监上天。 飞天者，飞天神王。 大者，都录之司。 丑者，宗伯。 总监者，总是飞天都统之官，监是领长夜之官。 上天者，升上天中也。 谓飞天神王总治天地之运，为三界之宗。 三界魔王皆受事，於其府总主领八会之炁，监主录长夜之魂，乘其命而升度幽魂於诸天。 此则元始以镇禁上天之云文。 沙陁劫量，龙汉瑛鲜。 沙者，此天有沙兰官。 隐者，陁丘山。 劫量者，随劫诠量。 龙汉者，始劫之名。 瑛者，飞天神王之讳。 鲜者，日童名也。 谓沙兰宫陁丘山乃紫微之别馆，系玉清新得受度而功未圆者，常有巨万人停散其中，皆龙汉时人。 俟劫交则诠其功而诣上宫。 人能明此音，则瑛君度人，沙兰鲜童引而炼形。 此则元始以镇常融天之云文。 碧落浮黎，空歌保珍。 碧落者，碧霞落落。 浮黎者，天王内讳。 空者，天中侍宸之名。 歌者，大洞之歌。 保者，保持。 珍者，珍爱。
chunks.translated_text:
The Venerable Lord Ruanle of Infinite Honor opens the path to deliver the long-night’s souls from dark obscurity. Divine winds, drifting and light, blow to restore the wandering hunts; the empty songs of cypress trees all resound with cavernous speech. At the first crow of the numinous cock upon Fusang’s tip, perfected ones gather and consume cloud-sprouts. The macaque, not riding the course of fate, responds to Qian’s origin, revolving through the nine cycles to guard the root of heaven. When the kalpa ends, the Bird Mother meets at Dragon Gate; disciples ride the phoenix to ascend Kunlun. Receiving talismans in the Feathered Forest, they bow to new grace, their cloud-garments misty and distant as they attend the imperial chariot.

The Great Ugly of the Flying Heavens oversees and governs the ascent to heaven. *Flying Heavens* refers to the Flying Heaven Divine King. *Great* denotes the office of comprehensive record-keeping. *Ugly* is the ancestral minister. *Oversees* means the Flying Heavens’ supreme commander; *governs* is the overseer of the long-night’s souls. *Ascent to heaven* means ascending into the heavens. It is said that the Flying Heaven Divine King governs the movements of heaven and earth, serving as the ancestral lord of the Three Realms. All demon kings of the Three Realms receive their duties from him; at his court, he presides over the qi of the Eight Assemblies, governing the recording of long-night souls, by whose command he delivers the obscure hunts to the various heavens. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes and restrains the heavens above.

The kalpa-measure of Shatuo, the radiance of Longhan. *Sha* refers to the Shalan Palace of this heaven. *Hidden* is Mount Tuoqiu. *Kalpa-measure* means to assess according to the kalpa. *Longhan* is the name of the primordial kalpa. *Radiance* is the taboo name of the Flying Heaven Divine King. *Fresh* is the name of the solar youth. It is said that the Shalan Palace and Mount Tuoqiu are detached halls of the Purple Tenuity, where those newly delivered who have not yet perfected their merit are often detained in great numbers, all people of the Longhan kalpa. When the kalpas turn, their merit is assessed, and they proceed to the upper palaces. chunks.original_text: 谓玉隆天常有碧霞落飞天神王，乘碧霞之辇，一日三回引导天中诸圣，七朝七宝，谒帝君而称庆。 於是侍宸一啸，灵风扇而成大洞之歌，保此天人不拘劫运，此曲尤为天人珍爱，故曰保珍。 此则元始以镇腾胜天之云文。 恶奕无品，洞妙自真。 恶奕者，天帝内音。 无者，太无真人。 品者，品量。 洞者，洞明。 妙者，此天有福堂日妙化。 自者，与也。 真者，合真。 谓恶奕天帝自元始祖劫修行，超出三界，位入玉虚，故得证大圣之位。 ，至赤明开图，元始锡为梵度天王，时勅太无真人开长夜之府，品度罪魂，使了然洞识宿命，净尽恶根，升入妙化之堂，与道合真矣。 此则元始以镇梵度天之云文。 元梵恢漠，幽寂度人。 元梵者，元始大梵，风泽之炁。 恢漠者，广大之辞。 幽者，幽寥。 寂者，虚寂。 度人者，度无量人。 谓元始大梵之炁恢漠无穷，高而洞浮，悬而不落，妙不可名，幽兮寂兮，不可见闻。 其中有真，真中有精，冥度天人。 此则元始以镇贾奕天之云文。 颂曰： 学人能识大洞章，三界魔王为录姓。 新受度者升陁山，劫终品量腾三景。 飞天进宴升碧霞，导引天中诸大圣。 一日三朝七宝宫，玉隆帝前自称庆。 太无真人度罪魂，普度洞然知宿命。 巍乎成功不可寻，元梵恢漠惟溟涬。 幽兮寂兮离见闻，中有真精精甚信。 度人济物妙难名，故曰隐语无量音。 道言：此诸天中大梵隐语无量之音，旧文字皆广长一丈。 天真皇人昔书其文以为正音，有知其音，能斋而诵之者，诸天皆遣飞天神王下观其身，书其功勤，上奏诸天。 万神朝礼，地祇侍门，大勋魔王，保举上仙，道备克得，游行三界，升入金门。 言此者，梵炁所结，隐秘之文，上能保镇天度，呼召天仙，下则利益生民，开度苦爽，故曰无量度人也。 旧文者，乃元始观梵炁流注之迹，合而成之字，皆周回一丈，薄於太虚。 每八字为一天炁之根，几诸天劫运成毁者，亦由字之散合所政也。 虽高圣莫晓其字，乃命皇人书为正音。 然得天仙则识之。
chunks.translated_text:
In the Jade Ascension Heaven, the Flying Celestial Divine Kings of Azure Radiance perpetually ride their azure radiance chariots, thrice daily guiding all the sages of the celestial realm to present the seven treasures in sevenfold audience before the Imperial Lord, offering their felicitations. Thereupon, the celestial attendant at the imperial throne emits a single whistle, and a numinous breeze fans forth, forming the grand cavernous hymn. This hymn safeguards the heaven’s people from the constraints of kalpic destiny, and thus is especially cherished by them—hence, it is called *preserving the precious*. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Soaring Victory.

*Evil play* is the inner sound of the Heavenly Emperor. *None* is the Supreme Noneness Perfected. *Rank* means to assess. *Cavernous* means to illumine thoroughly. *Wondrous* refers to the Heaven’s blessed hall, called Wondrous Transformation. *Self* means *with*. *True* means to unite with the True. It speaks of how the Heavenly Emperor of Evil Play, through cultivation since the Primordial Origin’s kalpa, transcended the Three Realms and entered the Jade Void, thereby attaining the position of Great Sage. By the time of the Crimson Clarity’s unfolding chart, the Primordial Origin bestowed upon him the title of Brahmā-Deliverance Heavenly King. At that time, he commanded the Supreme Noneness Perfected to open the Long Night’s repository, assessing and delivering sinful souls, enabling them to thoroughly comprehend their past lives, purify all evil roots, ascend into the hall of Wondrous Transformation, and unite with the Dao in truth. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Brahmā-Deliverance Heaven.

*Primordial Brahmā* is the great Brahmā of the Primordial Origin, the qi of wind and marsh. *Vast and boundless* is an expression of vastness. *Profound* means secluded and desolate. *Still* means empty and silent. *Delivering people* means delivering boundless beings. It speaks of how the qi of the Primordial Origin’s great Brahmā is vast and boundless, lofty and pervading the void, suspended yet never falling, ineffably subtle, profound and still, beyond sight and sound. Within it lies the True; within the True lies the essence, silently delivering the heaven’s people. This is the cloud-script by which the Primordial Origin stabilizes the Heaven of Wondrous Play.

The ode states:
When learners recognize the grand cavernous verses,
The demon kings of the Three Realms record their names.
Newly delivered ones ascend Mount Tuo,
At kalpa’s end, their merit assessed, they soar through the Three Luminaries.
Flying celestials advance to feast, ascending azure radiance,
Guiding the sages of the celestial realm.
Thrice daily they audience in the Seven Treasures Palace,
Before the Jade Ascension Emperor, offering their felicitations.
The Supreme Noneness Perfected delivers sinful souls,
Universally delivering them to thorough knowledge of past lives.
Majestic is the achievement, beyond reckoning—
The Primordial Brahmā, vast and boundless, is but the cosmic abyss.
Profound, still, beyond perception,
Within it lies the True Essence, most faithful and true.
Delivering people, aiding beings, ineffably wondrous,
Thus it is called the hidden language of boundless sound.

The Dao states: These are the great Brahmā’s hidden languages of boundless sound within the heavens, their ancient script spanning a full *zhang* in length. The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign of Old inscribed their text to establish the correct intonation. Those who know these sounds and can fast and recite them will have the Flying Celestial Divine Kings descend to observe their forms, record their meritorious diligence, and report it to the heavens. Myriad spirits will pay homage, earth deities will attend at the gates, great merit demon kings will safeguard and recommend them as perfected immortals. Once their Dao is complete, they may traverse the Three Realms and ascend through the Golden Gate. This refers to the hidden script formed by Brahmā qi, which above can safeguard and stabilize the heavenly deliverance, summoning celestial immortals, and below can benefit the living, delivering suffering souls—hence, it is called *boundless deliverance of people*. The ancient script was formed by the Primordial Origin observing the traces of Brahmā qi’s flow, coalescing into characters, each a full *zhang* in circumference, thinner than the great void. Every eight characters serve as the root of a heaven’s qi. The formation and dissolution of all heavenly kalpas are also governed by the scattering and coalescing of these characters. Though even the loftiest sages cannot comprehend these characters, they commanded the Sovereign to transcribe them into the correct intonation. Only celestial immortals can recognize them.

chunks.original_text: 大勋魔王保举上仙者，都领三界之尊神，保举学人升入上仙品秩。 俟其道备，即得游行三界，拜谒金门。 颂曰： 大梵灵章隐秘文，皇人改正始流传。 斋心诵处诸天悦，即得升腾作上仙。 此音无所不辟，无所不禳，无所不度，无所不成，天真自然之音也。 故诵之致飞天下，观上帝遥唱，万神朝礼，三界侍轩，群妖束首。 鬼精自亡琳琅振响。 十方肃清，河海静默，山岳吞烟，万灵振伏，招集群仙。 天无氛秽，地无妖尘。 冥慧洞清，大量玄玄也。 前后标叙，可谓尽矣。 今此复以结叹灵宝所感功德一十四事。 书于卷末者，盖欲成就大洞之功也。 冥慧洞清，又为灵宝四种圣功。 冥者，冥契一切。 慧者，慧照无穷。 洞者，洞观十方。 清者，清净致极。 皆灵宝之道备，所获全德也。 大量玄玄者，道君感叹此经，利济普博，妙不可名也。 又匠成万物而不言我为者，玄之德也。 玄而又玄，众妙之门，故云 大量玄玄也。 颂日： 三洞诸经贵玉音，文章错落灿珠金。 保天镇地禳灾厄，度尽尘沙无鞅人。 参校曰：灵书中篇乃三十二天保镇开度之梵音，诵咏宣扬，功用莫大。 而三十二天又为天人学人修证升进等级之品，三界有三乘之分，种民入上乘之最，性命混融，与道合真。 故道言成终总括。 又以冥慧洞清表之，且申以大量玄玄者，亦备迷大乘与上乘玄觉之妙欤。 赞日：大象冥冥，至玄之名。 冥合玄玄，视而无形。 窈冥有精，梵炁深凝。 寂兮寥兮，合道混成。 何以言慧，至神之义。 正慧自然，神光所丽。 无幽不烛，无之不遂。 自然而然，如是如是。 何以言洞，真空之谓。 天中空洞，载在经旨。 纤毫无滞，贯彻表里。 空无所空，洞然而已。 何以言清，真一之称。 《道德经》曰：得一以清。 生一之始，大罗玉清。 纯清绝点，归于无形。 冥慧洞清，四者之全。 空玄妙混，玄之又玄。 空有两忘，无无亦然。 其太上洞玄灵宝无量度人之极功欤。 元始灵书下篇　天真皇人撰 东方八天 森角储云，九魂炼精。 枳默窥玦，浮枚曰。 鹿几扬房，碧提酇回。 池滇党负，跂逭谒携。 藻章变瑜，兰泮碧环。 亢傍野生，极中昆清。 耀展洞涸，寂无妙凝。 素倚虚罗，皇达元灵。 南方八天 炎镀绰堂，太霄瑶隅。 历遐荐倚，周扃加图。 披峣蹊臄，觚亶浑都。 戟芸荼炫，井欺持蒲。 掌维迮仪，奕晃琅璀。 扁缕益但，幽微毕雷。 涓湟寔东，赤曜丛稽。 玉玄演侯，柏璖至规。 西方八天 镐正左适，婆尼煞灵。 悲招均疆，洎南躔魁。 静夷损光，混元觉缘。 道守岑遥，绵征知宣。 太灵湮漠，炳和卢随。 哲京常华，墟咸坚沙。 栗铎黜株，会衍球裴。 卓云青府，业睹般基。 北方八天 洼孩蒙甘，翠宇九阑。 萧钩涟兴，龙汾神关。 沟沦泬魔，豁蛮祈通。 玄寥亢息，无知肆明。 蟒修吉夕，馥坛时畎。 汤长敷昌，匪庸谨济。 朝康堲宽，秘法侈宜。 广帝理生，卫肇宏人。 天真皇人梵炁玄辽，天宝自然八合之音，主治世会地垒洪泽变灾厄难。 诵咏之者，禳辟妖祥，清静道炁，无不宁也。 地官奉书，百灵畏敬，神朱写文，服佩明验，施之於至学，不宣於下俗也。 太极真人颂 神云焕层虚，梵罗屯碧霄。 元始九龙驾，皇人按青轺。 灵光集万真，珠影开阳寥。 出示灵宝篇，福德由是招。
chunks.translated_text:
The Great Merit Demon King who safeguards and recommends ascended immortals serves as the supreme deity governing the Three Realms, recommending disciples to ascend into the ranks of upper immortals. When their Dao is complete, they may roam the Three Realms and pay homage at the Golden Gate.

A hymn says:
*The sacred script of the Great Brahmā, hidden and secret,
Transcribed by the Sovereign, now spreads in its true form.
With a purified heart, recite it—all heavens rejoice,
And you shall ascend to become an upper immortal.*

This sound repels all, dispels all, delivers all, and accomplishes all—it is the natural sound of celestial perfected beings. Thus, reciting it causes flying immortals to descend, the Supreme Emperor to gaze from afar, the ten thousand spirits to pay homage, the Three Realms to attend in reverence, and all demons to bow in submission. Ghostly essences vanish at its resonant tones. The ten directions grow solemn and clear, rivers and seas fall silent, mountains and peaks swallow their mists, the myriad spirits tremble and submit, and immortals gather in assembly. The heavens are free of defilement, the earth free of demonic dust. Profound wisdom illumines the void, and the vastness of the mysterious deepens infinitely.

The preceding and following passages may be said to encompass all. Here, once more, we conclude by extolling fourteen merits of the *Lingbao* scriptures, inscribed at the end of this scroll to perfect the workings of the Great Cavern. *Profound wisdom illumining the void* constitutes the four sacred powers of the *Lingbao*:

*Profound* (冥) signifies profound resonance with all things.
*Wisdom* (慧) signifies boundless illumination.
*Cavern* (洞) signifies penetrating vision across the ten directions.
*Pure* (清) signifies utmost purity.

These are the complete virtues attained when the Dao of the *Lingbao* is fulfilled. *The vastness of the mysterious deepens infinitely* (大量玄玄): The Lord of the Dao, moved by this scripture’s boundless beneficence and ineffable wonder, cannot name its merit. To craft the myriad things without claiming credit—this is the virtue of the mysterious. Mysterious beyond mystery, the gate of all wonders—hence, it is called *the vastness of the mysterious deepens infinitely*.

A hymn says:
*The Three Caverns’ scriptures treasure the jade-like sound,
Their words resplendent, gleaming like pearls and gold.
They safeguard heaven, stabilize earth, dispel calamities,
Delivering all beings, endless as grains of dust.*

A collation states: The middle section of the *Lingbao* scriptures contains the Brahmā sounds of the thirty-two heavens, which safeguard and deliver. To recite and proclaim them is of immeasurable merit. The thirty-two heavens also serve as the ranks for heavenly beings and disciples in their cultivation and ascent. The Three Realms are divided into three vehicles, and the seed people enter the highest vehicle, where nature and life merge, uniting with the Dao in truth. Thus, the Dao’s completion is summarized in full. *Profound wisdom illumining the void* expresses this, and *the vastness of the mysterious deepens infinitely* further elucidates the wondrous awakening of the Great Vehicle and the supreme mystery.

A eulogy says:
*The great image is profoundly obscure, the name of the utmost mystery.
Obscurely uniting with the mysterious, seen yet formless.
In the depths of the void, Brahmā qi congeals.
Silent and vast, it merges with the Dao in perfection.*

What is *wisdom*? It is the meaning of the utmost spirit.
True wisdom arises naturally, adorned by the radiance of the spirit.
It illuminates all hidden realms, accomplishing all without exception.
Spontaneous and thus, such is its nature.

What is *cavern*? It is the designation of true emptiness.
The emptiness within heaven is expounded in the scriptures’ essence.
Not a single fine detail is obstructed, penetrating both inner and outer.
Emptiness is no-emptiness—only the state of being cavernous.

What is *pure*? It is the title of the True One.
The *Daode Jing* says: *Attain the One to achieve purity.*
At the origin of the One’s arising lies the Great Luo and Jade Purity.
Utterly pure, without blemish, returning to formlessness.

*Profound wisdom illumining the void*—these four are complete.
Emptiness and mystery merge in wondrous unity, mysterious beyond mystery.
Both being and non-being are forgotten, even nothingness is transcended.
Such is the ultimate merit of the *Taishang Dongxuan Lingbao Wuliang Duren*.

**Lower Section of the *Yuanshi Lingbao* Scripture**
*Composed by the Heavenly Perfected Sovereign*

**The Eight Heavens of the East:**
Senjiao stores clouds, nine souls refine essence.
Jimo gazes at the jade, Fumei speaks in silence.
Deer ascend the chamber, Biti winds in circles.
Chidian bears the burden, Qi Huan carries the jade.
Algae and waterweeds transform into jade, orchids and ice form green rings.
Kangpang grows wild, the center of Kun is pure.
Radiance spreads through the cavernous void, silence congeals in wondrous stillness.
The plain leans on the empty net, the Sovereign reaches the Primordial Spirit.

**The Eight Heavens of the South:**
Yanduo’s hall gleams, Tai Xiao’s jade corners shine.
Lixia leans in reverence, Zhoujiong adds to the chart.
Peaks rise steeply, paths twist through the wilds.
Gudan’s capital, Hun Du’s expanse.
Halberds and herbs blaze, wells and reeds hold fast.
Palms and standards press close, Yi Huang’s jade glitters.
Carved patterns and threads weave, the subtle and hidden thunder resounds.
Juan Huang flows east, red radiance gathers in clusters.
Jade mystery unfolds the lord, cypress and jade reach perfection.

**The Eight Heavens of the West:**
Gaozheng turns left, Poni slays spirits.
Sorrow summons the borders, Ji Nan treads the stars.
Jing Yi dims its light, Hun Yuan awakens the edge.
The Dao guards distant peaks, Mian Zheng knows the proclamation.
Tai Ling sinks into stillness, Bing He follows Lu Sui.
Wisdom’s capital blooms eternally, the ruins stand firm in sand.
Liduo casts out the stock, Hui Yan gathers the spheres.
Zhuo Cloud’s green mansion, Ye Du beholds the foundation.

**The Eight Heavens of the North:**
Wahai nurtures sweetness, Cui Yu’s nine gates.
Xiaogou ripples in waves, Long Fen’s divine pass.
Ditches and abysses dissolve demons, Huo Man prays for passage.
Xuan Liao’s breath ceases, Wu Zhi’s brilliance shines.
Mang Xiu’s auspicious evening, Fu Tan’s timely furrows.
Tang Chang spreads prosperity, Fei Yong aids in caution.
Zhao Kang’s peace and ease, secret methods flourish.
Guang Di governs life, Wei Zhao’s vast humanity.

The Heavenly Perfected Sovereign’s Brahmā qi stretches into the distant mystery—the natural sounds of the eightfold celestial treasure—governing the world’s epochs, the earth’s upheavals, and the transformation of calamities and disasters. Those who recite them dispel inauspicious omens, purify the Dao’s qi, and bring about tranquility without exception. The Earthly Officials uphold the scripture, the hundred spirits revere and respect it. Divine cinnabar transcribes the text, wearing it brings evident verification. It is bestowed upon the most advanced disciples and not disclosed to the vulgar below.

**Eulogy by the Perfected One of the Great Ultimate:**
Divine clouds gleam in layered emptiness, Brahmā nets gather in the azure sky.
The Primordial Origin’s nine dragons draw the chariot, the Sovereign guides the blue carriage.
Spiritual light gathers the myriad perfected, pearl-like radiance opens the vast void.
Revealing the *Lingbao* scriptures, blessings and virtues are thereby summoned.

chunks.original_text: 洞玄隐高严，玉音泛云璈。 无量匪得思，道海生波涛。 法义同涓流，滋植成嘉苗。 用以账穷饥，教兴卫中朝。 帝尊寿亿年，太平灭兵刀。 稽首望玉宸，灵华散金毫。 参校总赞曰：太上真经，无量度人。 人所以生父母之身，始生之根，与天地均，同禀梵炁，聚精生神。 凡躯所累，六根六尘； 三业所毒，首曰食嗔； 逐流忘返，浸失善因。 天尊慈悯，弘济天民，性命妙混，经典开陈。 复归其根，不堕转轮。 妙经初宣，道性为先。 静默朗清，真净本源。 高下平等，不间山川。 玉相纯色，皆表性天。 空玄之中，宝珠之悬。 真源既证，真空又全。 寂无遗响，尽归忘言。 何以了命，炼炁成仙。 中理五炁，得玄牝门。 百神混合，十转胎圆。 蜕凡而真，体入自然。 所以致此，功行兼焉。 行满八百，功足三千。 诸天记功，毫分不愆。 魔王界中，明炁四骞。 懈退有戒，金石非坚。 保举尔身，飞行翩翩。 空有俱寂，染习绝源。 超过三界，玉虚高迁。 依经行持，得鱼之筌。 道子作赞，莫尽玄玄。 天恩覆冒，普度无边。 元始无量度人上品妙经注卷下竟 诵度人经应验 杜三师修诵经验 阆州天庆观道士杜延真，精心修行，常持诵《度人经》。 以衣钵修经庵石老君，安龟像之座，满堂尽绘经中出相，严洁无怠。 年七十八岁，一日忽谓众曰：尔不乐仙道，三界那得过； 大众暂别，各保岁寒。 言讫，屈膝跪化。
chunks.translated_text:
The Mystic Cavern’s lofty solemnity,
Jade tones ripple like cloud-borne zithers.
Boundless, beyond thought’s reach,
The Dao’s ocean surges with waves.
Dharma’s meaning flows as a gentle stream,
Nurturing fine sprouts to flourish.
Applied to relieve the destitute and hungry,
Its teachings flourish to guard the central court.
The August Emperor’s life spans a hundred million years,
Great Peace extinguishes blades and swords.
Bowing in reverence toward the Jade Celestial Court,
Divine blossoms scatter from golden brushstrokes.

**Comprehensive Eulogy:**
The Most High’s true scripture,
Boundlessly delivers humankind.
The body with which one is born of father and mother,
The root of one’s beginning,
Stands equal with Heaven and Earth,
Alike endowed with Brahmā’s qi,
Essence gathered to generate spirit.
Yet the mortal frame is burdened
By the six roots and six dusts;
The three karmas are poisoned,
First by gluttony, then by wrath.
Following the current, one forgets to return,
Gradually losing the good cause.
The Heavenly Worthy, in compassion,
Vastly saves the people of Heaven.
The wondrous merging of nature and life,
The scriptures lay open.
Returning to one’s root,
One does not fall into the turning wheel.

When the wondrous scripture was first proclaimed,
The nature of the Dao took precedence.
Silent and luminous, pure and clear,
The true and pristine source.
High and low, all equal,
Unobstructed by mountains and rivers.
The Jade Form’s pure hue
Manifests the nature of Heaven.
Within the emptiness of the Mystic,
A treasure pearl hangs suspended.
Once the true source is realized,
True emptiness is also complete.
Silent, without lingering resonance,
All returns to wordless forgetting.

How to comprehend life?
Refine qi to become immortal.
Align the five qi at the center,
Attain the Mysterious Female’s gate.
The hundred spirits merge as one,
The ten transformations of the embryo perfected.
Shedding the mortal to become true,
The body enters spontaneity.

To achieve this,
Meritorious deeds and practices must combine.
With eight hundred deeds fulfilled,
Three thousand merits accomplished,
The heavens record the deeds,
Not a hair’s breadth amiss.
Within the demon kings’ realm,
Luminous qi soars in four directions.
Sloth and retreat are warned against,
Gold and stone are not enduring.
Preserving and recommending one’s person,
One soars in flight, light and graceful.
Emptiness and existence both quiescent,
The source of defilements cut off.
Transcending the Three Realms,
Ascending to the Jade Void’s heights.

Following the scripture in practice,
One grasps the fish through the trap.
Disciples compose eulogies,
Yet the Mysterious cannot be exhausted.
Heaven’s grace overshadows all,
Universally delivering without limit.

**End of the Lower Scroll of the *Highest Prime’s Boundless Deliverance of Humankind, Supreme and Wondrous Scripture with Commentary***

**Verified Efficacy of Reciting the *Scripture of Deliverance***
**Master Du’s Experience in Recitation and Cultivation**

Du Yanzhen, a Daoist of Tianqing Abbey in Langzhou, devoted himself to cultivation and constantly recited the *Scripture of Deliverance*. Using his robe and alms bowl, he built a stone shrine to the Elder Lord, installing a tortoise-borne statue within. The entire hall was adorned with scenes depicted from the scripture, kept solemn and immaculate without negligence. At the age of seventy-eight, one day he suddenly addressed the assembly: “If you do not delight in the immortal Dao, how can you pass through the Three Realms? For now, I bid farewell to all. Preserve your resolve through the cold of years.” Having spoken, he knelt and transformed.

Divine clouds gleam in layered emptiness, Brahmā nets gather in the azure sky.
The Primordial Origin’s nine dragons draw the chariot, the Sovereign guides the blue carriage.
Spiritual light gathers the myriad perfected, pearl-like radiance opens the vast void.
Revealing the *Lingbao* scriptures, blessings and virtues are thereby summoned.

chunks.original_text: 既葬之后，冢上常有白光，居人异之。 其诸徒共视，则冢有一穴而尸不见，止存双履而已。 然众亦未晓。 忽有人自成都来，云：杜三师有书。 启缄视之，乃云：传言石太上，勤谨视乡龟。 此谓石老君也。 此则方悟尊师已获尸解矣。 刘氏女诵经验 绍熙间，果州居民刘氏有女，年七岁。 一日有道人诵经缘化，因白父母曰：此所诵者何经？ 答曰：《度人经》。 女子敬欲受之，父母从之。 不旬月，悉能记忆。 日夜诵念不歇。 一日西邻大火，其家正在烈焰中，人但闻诵经声不歇。 将已为灰烬，俄有大风回旋，火势遂过刘氏一家，了无所害。 岂非经中神明护门之验耶！ 因镂板印施以传之。 王明听经验 庆元间，梓府宝珠会，凡遇诵经，有跛者王明策杖常至听经。 一日听经至十方无量度人处，似有壮力拽其脚，视之不见，遂弃杖而归。 人问其故，明曰：予二十年听经，方知四徧说经，跛痾积逮皆能起行之验。 张将仕诵经验 淳熙间，阆州东街张将仕，晚年从黄冠受《度人经》。 每旦夜斋洁灶香，调声正气，转诵数过，凡三十年。 忽一日，谓家人曰：尔等安知吾学尸解之道！ 寻即果捐一馆，时年七十七岁。 公丁亥生，既葬，再越月，复值丁亥日，忽於凡筵灰烬中产莲华九茎，色甚鲜白，修纤踰尺。 因命亲族聚观，共相嘉叹。 越三日，华乃萎，根植宛若。 因阅经蕴，则有欲生因莲华之句，方悟其事。 后有子辛，於嘉泰甲子与乡荐，今为望族。 任照诵经验 合州石照县吏任照於嘉泰间，因目疾丧明，遂弃职，诵《度人经》以求痊。 忽一日，双目顿明。 於是愈加勤恪，发大誓愿，将《度人经》写成，元始天尊圣像刊行首，以化导本州天庆观，化《道藏》及藏经功德。 不日落成，以是观之，岂非经中所谓说经二徧，盲者目明之验欤。

After the burial, a constant white light shone above the tomb, astonishing the local residents. When his disciples examined it together, they found a cavity in the mound and no trace of the body—only a pair of shoes remained. Yet none understood its meaning. Suddenly, a man arrived from Chengdu, saying, “Master Du has sent a letter.” Upon opening it, they read: *“Convey to the Stone Most High: tend diligently to the village tortoise.”* This referred to the stone statue of the Elder Lord. Only then did they realize their revered master had attained liberation through the dissolution of the corpse.

**Verified Efficacy of the Liu Family Daughter’s Recitation**
During the Shaoxi era, in Guozhou, a resident named Liu had a seven-year-old daughter. One day, a Daoist monk came to recite scriptures for alms, prompting the girl to ask her parents, *“What scripture is this?”* They replied, *“The* Scripture of Deliverance.*”* The girl expressed reverence and begged to receive it; her parents consented. Within less than a month, she had memorized it entirely and recited it day and night without cease. One day, a great fire broke out in the western neighbor’s home, engulfing her family in flames. Yet only the sound of her uninterrupted recitation could be heard. As the fire was about to reduce everything to ashes, a sudden whirlwind reversed its course, sparing the Liu household entirely. Was this not proof of the scripture’s divine protection over the faithful? Thereafter, she had printing blocks carved to disseminate the text.

**Verified Efficacy of Wang Ming’s Listening to the Scripture**
During the Qingyuan era, at the Baozhu Assembly in Zifu, a lame man named Wang Ming, who always leaned on a staff, regularly attended scripture recitations. One day, as the recitation reached the passage *“Deliverance of the Boundless Multitudes in the Ten Directions,”* he felt a surge of strength pulling at his feet. Though he saw nothing, he abandoned his staff and returned home. When asked the reason, Wang said, *“After twenty years of listening to the scripture, I have only now realized the efficacy of reciting it four times—even long-standing lameness can be cured.”*

**Verified Efficacy of Attendant Zhang’s Recitation**
During the Chunxi era, Zhang Jiangshi of the eastern street in Langzhou, in his later years, received the *Scripture of Deliverance* from a Daoist master. Each dawn and night, he purified himself, lit incense at the stove, regulated his voice and qi, and recited the scripture several times over—continuing thus for thirty years. One day, he suddenly told his family, *“Do you know I have studied the Way of corpse liberation?”* Soon after, he indeed departed this world in a separate chamber at the age of seventy-seven. Born in a *dinghai* year, after his burial, a month later—on another *dinghai* day—nine lotus stems emerged from the ashes of his funeral pyre, their color pure white and their slender stalks over a foot long. He summoned his relatives to witness this marvel, and all marveled in admiration. Three days later, the flowers withered, though their roots remained intact. Upon consulting the scripture’s hidden meanings, they found the line *“Those who seek rebirth arise from the lotus,”* and only then did they comprehend the event. Later, his son Xin passed the provincial examination in the *jiazi* year of Jiatai and became a prominent family.

**Verified Efficacy of Ren Zhao’s Recitation**
During the Jiatai era, Ren Zhao, a clerk in Shizhao County of Hezhou, lost his sight due to an eye ailment and resigned his post. He recited the *Scripture of Deliverance* in hopes of a cure. One day, his eyesight suddenly returned. Thereafter, he redoubled his devotion, vowing solemnly to transcribe the *Scripture of Deliverance* and commission an image of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy to be printed at its beginning. He used this to propagate the teachings at Tianqing Abbey in his prefecture, dedicating the merit to the reproduction of the *Daoist Canon* and its scriptures. The project was completed in no time. Was this not the fulfillment of the scripture’s promise that *“reciting it twice restores sight to the blind”*?
